loans.name: Edwin Oswaldo

texts.es:
Edwin es un hombre de 39 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Edwin no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Ingeniería Civil que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta hacer deporte y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Arroz con Pollo para compartir con su familia. 
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Edwin como vigilante brindando servicios de seguridad en un grifo de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Edwin se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea comprar materiales de construcción para refaccionar la fachada de su vivienda, de esta manera Edwin tendrá mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de terminar la construcción total de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Edwin is a 39 year old man and lives in the city of Pisco. He is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person, who dedicates all of his efforts to going forward. Unfortunately, because of a lack of financial resources and because of the necessity of having to work since a young age to help her parents, Edwin was not able to study for the professional career of a civil engineer as he wanted to. In his free time, he likes to play sports and, on occasion, cook a delicious rice with chicken dish to share with his family. 

By his own initiative, with a lot of determination and dedication, Edwin works as a guard offering security services in a gas station. He works everyday for approximately 10 hours. He thinks that he is successful because of his good performance and because of the kind way he treats people.

Edwin is very thankful for Kiva loans, since thanks to the help, he will be able to improve his home, as he wants to buy construction materials to repair the facade of his home. In this way, Edwin will have better security and wellbeing, so he will continue working and making an effort to succeed in his dream of finishing construction on his home.

loans.use: to improve his home

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty lives in the Litein area of Kenya. She has 3 children and has been doing farming work for 9 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and tea.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "Selling products!" Her biggest challenge is "cultivating," and animals on the farm have been given the names of "Kru."

Betty was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, "It offers a grace period."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session. She responded, "Grace period given to farmers."

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan will benefit her family, Betty replied that it will help her educate her children.

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Betty owns a cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. In the household, this borrower has a mosquito net and TV, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, or a DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Aliya

texts.en:
Aliya is from Iraq. She is 56 years old, married, and has 2 children. Aliya and her children take part in providing the family's income.

Aliya tailors women's outfits and children's wear. She has been practicing this business since 2007 and has gained her experience in tailoring from her mother, who was also a tailor. Aliya is well-known in the area, thanks to her clean work and professional delivery.

Aliya is requesting a loan of 2,500 USD. She will use this loan to buy a specialized sewing machine and a motor generator. She is aiming to grow her business and increase her profits so that she may buy more sewing machines and teach sewing to unemployed women in the neighborhood.

loans.use: to buy a specialized sewing machine and a motor generator

loans.name: Fares

texts.en: Fares is 52 years old and lives in Qwesmeh, Jordan. He is divorced and has 7 children. Faris owns a coffee and tea cafeteria; he earns a small income, but it is not enough to cover his children's needs. Now he seeks a loan to redecorate the shop to turn it into a better place and expand it in order to earn a better income.

loans.use: to redecorate and expand his coffee and tea shop

loans.name: Walter Enrique

texts.es:
Walter es un hombre de 22 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; gracias a su esfuerzo y al apoyo de sus padres, Walter se encuentra estudiando la carrera profesional de Ingeniería de Sistemas que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina una riquísima Carapulcra con Sopa Seca para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Walter trabaja en el área de cobranzas de una empresa comercial de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 8 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Walter se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de materiales de estudios, como libros, separatas y herramientas para ensamble de computadoras, de esta manera Walter podrá seguir cursando adecuadamente sus estudios, así pues él seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de ser un gran profesional y tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Walter, 22 years old, is single and lives in the city of Chincha with his parents and siblings. He is a very kind, enthusiastic, and hard-working person with a great desire to succeed. Thanks to his efforts and the support of his parents, Walter is studying a professional career in Systems Engineering like he wanted. In his free time, he likes to play soccer with his friends and, sometimes, he cooks the delicious Carapulcra with Sopa Seca to share with his family.

On his own initiative, and with much determination and dedication, Walter works in the field of collections for a business in the city. He works every day for around 8 hours and thinks it is going well due to his good performance and kind treatment toward others.

Walter is very grateful for the Kiva loans. Thanks to this help, he can buy study materials such as books, separate parts and tools to assemble computers. This way, Walter can continue his schooling and also keep working to achieve his dream of becoming a profession and having his own home.

loans.use: to buy study materials and tools

loans.name: Feliza

texts.en:
This is Feliza. She previously accessed a 40,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help in her personal, household, and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 50,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing this loan to buy gardening materials, like wire, baskets, and supplies, such as seeds and fertilizer. Her profits from her business will definitely help her sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Feliza dreams that her business will continue to grow. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God they study.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for gardening materials, like wire, baskets, and supplies

loans.name: Sherlita

texts.en: Sherlita is 44 years old, married, and has four children. She lives in Water Fall, Aurora, Zamboanga del Sur. For some years Sherlita has woven nipa palm  into mats that are used as roofing materials. Every month, she earns 6,000 PHP from this business. Sherlita became a member of GDMPC in 2011. Recently, she has again requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy the materials needed to make more nipa palm roofing. She hopes to improve and expand her business with the anticipated profits.

loans.use: to buy the materials needed to make more nipa palm roofing

loans.name: Rocky

texts.en:
Rocky has worked as a farmer for five years and as a hog raiser for three years. Rocky is not yet married but he has a child.  

Rocky would like to borrow a loan of PHP 25,000, which will be used to buy feed and vaccines to ensure the proper nutrition and growth of his hogs. He hopes that the lenders will provide him with financial assistance so he can make his business grow and provide for the needs of his child.

loans.use: to buy supplies of feed and vaccines for his hogs

loans.name: Jocel

texts.en:
Jocel works hard to support her family. Jocel is married and has a business buying and selling ready to wear clothing in the Philippines.

Jocel requested a PHP 12000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock of ready to wear clothing to sell.

Jocel has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Jocel would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of ready to wear clothing to sell

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 66 years old, married, and has nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Editha has a food production business in the Philippines. Editha requested a PHP 29500 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Editha has been in this business for twelve years. In the future, Editha would like to save enough money to rent a space at public market.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
This is Rose. Her previous loan was a big help to her business. She was able to buy more products for her variety store. The loan also helped with their household expenditures. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs.

She would like to apply for another 35,000 PHP loan to buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her current inventory. The more items displayed at the store, the better. More items to sell will result in better profits. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Rose hopes that her business will expand. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en:
Mohammed, 24 years-old, is a Yemeni youth client. He lives in Taiz, Yemen, and he is the breadwinner of his family (relatives). He has not gotten married yet because he doesn`t have enough money to improve his living standards.

Now he owns a small house which is very old and needs renovating and the building of a second floor, so he requested a youth loan in the amount of 400,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies. He looks forward to furnishing his house and getting married.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies for house

loans.name: Nera

texts.en: Nera works hard to support her family. She is married and has a business selling purified water in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional containers and materials for her business. Nera has been in this business for 4 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional containers and materials for her business

loans.name: Jaen

texts.es:
Jaen es un hombre de 27 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Camana, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Jaen no pudo estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar futbol con sus amigos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Chupe de Camarones para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Jaen trabaja como chofer de mototaxi, brindando servicios de transporte en su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, el se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien porque conoce las zonas donde encontrar mayor cantidad de pasajeros.
Jaen se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea comprar materiales de construcción para refaccionar el techado de su hogar, pues se acercan las épocas de lluvias y quiere tener mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues Jaen seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener un auto para poder trabajar como taxista.
texts.en:
Jaen, 27, is single and lives in the city of Camaná.  He's a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic man who devotes all his effort to getting ahead.  Unfortunately, Jaen wasn't able to study for a degree because he lacked the resources and needed to work from a young age to help his parents.  In his free time he likes to play soccer with his friends, and sometimes he cooks a delicious shrimp chowder to share with his family.

On his own initiative and with a lot of effort and dedication, Jaen works as a motorcycle taxi driver offering transportation services in his city.  He works every day from early in the morning and can work up to approximately 10 hours.  He's comfortable doing his job and believes it's going well for him because he knows where to find a greater number of passengers.

Jaen is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because thanks to their help he'll be able to improve his house.  He wants to buy construction materials to repair his roof.  The rainy season is approaching and Jaen wants to have greater security and well-being.

This way he'll continue working and making the effort to realize his big dream of having a car to be able to work as a taxi driver.

loans.use: to improve his house

loans.name: Heliany

texts.es:
Heliany, es una joven emprendedora que a sus 19 años de edad, se visiona como una gran empresaria. Actualmente labora en call-center de una institución educativa, actividad que alterna con la venta de ropa a familiares, amigos y compañeros, desde hace aproximadamente un año. Asegura que es un negocio rentable por lo cual desea continuar con el desarrollo de la actividad y para ello se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido con el fin de entregar los encargos solicitados. 
Sueña con tener una gran tienda de ropa y brindarles a su madre y hermanos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Heliany is a young entrepreneur who is 19 years old. She sees herself becoming a great businesswoman. Right now, she works in the call center of an educational institution, an activity she has alternated with selling clothes to relatives, friends and co-workers for about a year. She says that that it is a profitable business and that is why she wants to continue developing her activity and to do that she is asking for a loan that she will invest in buying some merchandise in order to deliver the orders she has.  

She dreams of having a great clothing store and to offer her mother and her siblings a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: Mary Darlin

texts.en:
Mary Darlin is 35 years old and married with 2 children, who are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Mary Darlin has a business selling personal products in the Philippines. Mary Darlin requested a PHP 15000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more stock to sell.

Mary Darlin has been in this business for five years. In the future, Mary Darlin would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell.

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
This is Emelita. She previously accessed an 30,000 PHP loan that she utilized to buy gardening materials and supplies needed in her business. Her earnings were a big help for her children's education and for their personal, household, and business expenditures. 

She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs needed in her business. Her profits from this business will definitely help her sustain their daily needs and children's education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Emelita hopes that her business will continue to expand and dreams to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizer and farm inputs for her business.

loans.name: Redentor

texts.en:
This is Redentor. He previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. His earnings were a big help for the education of his child and in their personal, household and business expenditures.

He would like to apply for another 19,000 PHP loan for him to buy spare parts, for the maintenance of their tricycle unit and also to buy some equipment for their repair shop. His profits from his business will definitely help him to sustain their daily needs and educational expenses of his child. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart.

Redentor hopes that his business will grow bigger. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and to draw strength and inspiration from the bible he studies.* 

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts, accessories and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit

loans.name: Ma. Celita

texts.en:
This is Maria Celita. She previously accessed a 30,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more chicken and pork meat. Her earnings were a big help in their personal, household and business expenditures.

She would like to apply for another 30,000 PHP loan to purchase chicken and pork meat. Her profits from the business will definitely help her to sustain their daily needs. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Ma. Celita dreams that her business will stay longer. She meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and it is a place where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for chicken and pork meat that she needs in her business

loans.name: Edda

texts.en: Edda is 54 years old, married, and has 3 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a business selling plants in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other supplies. Edda has been in this business for 8 years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other supplies.

loans.name: Flor De Kantutas 32 Group

texts.es: El banco de emprendimiento  FLOR DE KANTUTAS 32 está compuesto por ocho integrantes, siete mujeres y un varón, la presidenta del banco es La Sra.  Cristina tiene 35 años,   ella se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad en su  tienda de barrio que se encuentran en la zona de Ballivian de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  va a usar este préstamo  para la compra de mercadería para surtir su negocio como abarrotes por mayor, dulces y refrescos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la mucha demanda que tiene y es ahí donde incrementa sus ventas, y necesita surtir su mercadería La Sra. Cristina enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia ya que existen varias tiendas en la zona, va a utilizar los beneficios en la compra de mas mercadería para surtir su tienda y seguir creciendo más cada día, su deseo para  su negocio es de seguir vendiendo y tener una tienda surtida, así poder hacer crecer su negocio mejorar sus ingresos y por ende mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en: The "Flor de Kantutas 32" communal bank has eight members - seven women and one man.  The bank's president is 35-year-old Cristina, who makes a living selling staple goods at her grocery store in Ballivian, in the city of Cochabamba.  This is Cristina's first loan cycle with the institution and she will use this loan to buy merchandise to stock up her business, buying groceries in bulk, as well as sweets and drinks.  Cristina is applying for this loan because she has a lot of demand so she can increase her sales.  However, she needs to stock up on merchandise.  Cristina faces challenges with her business, such as competition as there are various shops in the area.  She will use her profits to stock up her store and to continue growing every day.  Cristina's wish is for her business is to continue selling and having the shop well-stocked.  She can then expand her business, improve her income and, consequently, raise her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy groceries in bulk.

loans.name: Alex Alfredo

texts.es:
Alex es un hombre de 20 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Camaná con sus padres y hermanos, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tiene de trabajar para ayudar a su familia, Alex no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Chupe de Camarones para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Alex trabaja como ayudante de cocina en un restaurante de su ciudad, el trabaja realizando labores de lavado de platos, picado de alimentos, legumbres y otros, Alex trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su buen desempeño y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Alex se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mejoramiento de su vivienda, ya que desea comprar materiales de construcción para cercar la parte trasera de su hogar, de esta manera el y su familia podrán tener mayor seguridad y bienestar, así pues Alex seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Alex is a 20 year old man. He is single and lives in the city of Camaná with his parents and siblings. He is a very kind, hardworking and enthusiastic  person who really wants to get ahead. Unfortunately, due to a lack of resources and because he has to work to help his family, Alex hasn't been able to go to school to learn a profession. In his free time, he likes to watch movies and sometimes cook a delicious Chupe de Camarones to share with his family. 

On his own initiative and with much hard work and dedication, Alex works as an assistant cook in a restaurant in his city. He works washing dishes, chopping vegetables and more. Alex works every day around 10 hours a day and he thinks it is going well for him because of his hard work and the kind way he treats others.

Alex is very grateful to the Kiva lenders, since thanks to their help he will be able to do some home improvements. He wants to buy construction materials to fence in the back part of his house. This way, his family can have more security and well being. Alex will keep working and striving to achieve his big dream of being able to go to school and have a career.

loans.use: to do home improvements.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy gifts to sell.

loans.name: Jesus

texts.es: Jesús de 59 años de edad, montó su propio negocio dedicado a la venta de productos de la canasta familiar con el fin de generar los recursos para el sostenimiento y educación de sus dos hijos. Con más de 20 años de experiencia en el sector, Jesús es conocido en su barrio como un hombre amable y caritativo que ha logrado salir adelante con disciplina y esfuerzo. Gracias a su negocio ha podido brindarles a sus dos hijos acceso a la educación y a una condición de vida favorable. Hoy tiene un sueño; ampliar su negocio con el fin de obtener mejores ingresos, lo que se verá reflejado en el bienestar de su familia. Razón por la cual, se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de surtido.
texts.en:
Jesús, 59, set up his own business selling staple products to generate income to support and educate his two children.  With more than 20 years of experience in the field, Jesús is well known in his neighborhood as a friendly and charitable man who has managed to get ahead with discipline and effort.  Thanks to his business he has been able to give his two children access to an education and a favorable quality of life.

Today he has a dream--to expand is business so he can earn a better income, which will lead to his family's well-being.  This is why he's requesting a loan to buy merchandise.

loans.use: to buy staple products

loans.name: Edelina

texts.en:
Edelina is 47 years old and married with 2 children. Edelina works very hard to provide for them.

Edelina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. Edelina has been in this business for six years, and sells a variety of items such as soap, sugar, rice, and other miscellaneous items. 

In the future, Edelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Apollo

texts.en: Apollo is a forty-seven year old married man with two children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a civil engineer and also runs a retail shop. From the proceeds he has been able to pay fees for his children despite the challenges of low salary and the current inflation. His plan is to expand his business to new areas. Apollo intends to use the loan to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell in his shop.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as soap and sugar to sell.

loans.name: Gerald

texts.en: Gerald is a thirty-eight year old married man with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He deals in the clothing business and also sells milk and coffee to boost his income. With the proceeds he has been able to pay fees for his children. His dream is to own a wholesale shop for clothes, though he faces the challenges of a lack of enough capital and bad weather. Gerald is requesting a loan to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Ngangi Kwaterana Group

texts.en:
Richard is a 40-year-old man who is married with 5 children and lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been in the commercial agriculture farming business for 4 years. He obtains additional income from cattle trade.

He started his business to get more income for educating his children, and his desire is to see them graduate with degrees. He faces a lack of capital to expand his farm plantation to a large estate. He hopes to buy a motorcycle to help him transport his milk to the market.

Richard is requesting a loan to buy farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. He is a member of the above named group in which each one guarantees the other to access a loan.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is 50 years old, married with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Mila has a general store business in the Philippines. Mila requested a PHP 25000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like soap, snack foods, and other groceries.

Mila has been in this business for eleven years. In the future, Mila would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soap, snack foods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Sheva May

texts.en:
Sheva May is 33 years old and a married mother of five. Three of the children are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Sheva May has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Sheva May has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Mariefa

texts.en:
Mariefa is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her business.

Mariefa has been in this business for three years. Mariefa earns more income from buying and selling vegetables, charcoal, and used clothes.

Mariefa has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Ramz Group

texts.en:
This group is called Ramz, which consists of three women who live in Taiz, Yemen.
Nashwa is 31 years old, married, and the mother of four children who live in Taiz, Yemen. She is a hardworking woman who faces a difficult challenge to provide for her family’s needs. She plans to raise livestock for selling, so she can earn a good profit. She is requesting a loan of 30,000 YER to buy livestock, including sheep and goats, for resale. She will use the additional income she earns to repay this loan, to cover the cost of paying for her children's education, and to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy livestock, including sheep and goats, for resale.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en: Marcelina is from Waterfall, Aurora, Zamboanga Del Sur. She is 53 years old and is married with one child. She earns a living raising crops, planting and harvesting corn for sale. Aside from farming, she also has had a business raising piglets for sale. In 2008, Marcelina joined GDMPC. She is requesting another loan of  7,000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed and other supplies. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and other supplies

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en: Myrna is 41 years old, married, and has two children. She sells vegetables, fruits and fish in their community. She is patiently selling every day to earn and save money for the education of her children.  She is now asking for additional capital of PHP 30,000 to buy camote, bananas, bitter melon, cabbage, tomatoes and spices to sell.  Myrna would like offer more variety of merchandise to meet the demands of her customers and create a good relationship with them.  She also hopes to have good sales so she can further provide for the growing needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy camote, bananas, bitter melons and cabbage, tomatoes and spices

loans.name: Lita

texts.en:
Lita is 60 years old and married with three children.

Lita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, soap, noodles, eggs, spices, and more.

Lita has borrowed and repaid 18 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years, and also earns an income from buying and selling rice.

Lita aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, soap, noodles, eggs, spices, and more.

loans.name: Fred

texts.en:
Fred is a 31-year-old married man with three children living in Kagadi, Uganda. For eleven years, he has been working as a civil servant, and a good father that he is, he has been able to pay fees for his children with his little salary.

He also started a retail shop to raise money that can help him in meeting his family daily expenses.  His dream is to own a wholesale shop. 

Fred is requesting a loan for general merchandise, such as soap and cassava flour, to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise, such as soap and cassava flour, to sell.

loans.name: Lena

texts.en:
43-year-old Lena lives with her 15 and 19 year old sons in Baghdati district. Lena requested loans from local financial institutions several times for her family business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected every time, because of low income and family’s poor living conditions. 
The only source of the income for the family is from agriculture. They own a small plot of land, where vegetables are grown. Harvested products are used by the family and sold at the local market. 
Lena requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. Lena has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. With her credit Lena will start trading clothes from Turkey. She will go there to purchase products at the wholesale price, bring it to her district, and sell with the price markup among the villagers. The new business will give Lena an opportunity to increase the family income and to be able to provide proper living conditions for her children.

loans.use: To trade clothes from Turkey

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy doors for the house that he is constructing.

loans.name: Wilfreda

texts.en:
Wilfreda is from Kinuman Norte, Ozamis City. She is 57 years old and married, with four children. 

To make a living, Wilfreda has run a retail store for years and earns PHP 2,841 a month from these activities. Aside from her retail store, she also manages their own farm, harvesting coconut for sale. 

In 2011, Wilfreda joined GDMPC, so she gained access to microfinance services. She recently requested an amount of PHP 8,700 to purchase fertilizer such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue to save as a reserve for future emergencies.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip, a 40-year-old man from Kakamega, located in the western part of Kenya, is married to Leah, a business lady; he supports four people in his family and has three children who are ten, seven and two years old.

Philip has been operating a retail shop for the last three years, earning a monthly income of KES. 9,000. Now requesting his third loan with KADET LTD to purchase sugar, salt, cooking oil and other goods for his shop, he will reinvest the anticipated profit in the shop.

Philip's dream is to develop his business into a wholesale operation and take good care of his family by providing for their basic needs.

loans.use: to purchase sugar, salt and cooking oil for resale.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is 62 years old and married with four children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines.

Mary is borrowing 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs. She has been raising pigs for ten years and also earns additional income from selling jewelry.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.en: Leticia is a 43 year old widower with three children. She works alone in supporting the needs of her family.  She decided to open up a variety store to earn daily income to support her family and help meet the household expenses.  She sells different grocery items and has been very accommodating in attending to the needs of her customers. Her desire to improve her sales made her decide to borrow a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy canned goods, eggs, bread, soap and other basic commodities to sell.  She hopes that the lenders will grant her request so she can make her business progressive someday.

loans.use: to buy canned goods, eggs, bread and soap to sell

loans.name: Expedito

texts.en:
Expedito is a 45-year-old married man with four children. He lives in Kyenjojo, Uganda. He has been in the meat-roasting business along the street. He started with capital of 70,000 shillings received through a solidarity group guarantee, and now has working capital worth 2,000,000 shillings. 

He experiences hardship due to price fluctuation. His vision is a wholesale business plus educating his children.

Expedito intends to use the loan to buy soap, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.use: to buy soap, sugar and rice to sell.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 57 years old and married with eight children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Vilma runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

She has been in this business for 16 years and sells a variety of items, such as rice, sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Martha Del Socorro

texts.es: Doña Martha ha sido madre soltera, ha buscado siempre la manera de salir adelante junto a sus hijos, haciendo tortillas y puso una pequeña pulpería con lo que también se está apoyando un poco ya que también tiene que pagar alquiler del local para poder vender en el día, en la actualidad tiene dos de sus hijos a su cargo quienes están estudiando. Doña Martha solicita el crédito para ir mejorando su casita la que va avanzando poco a poco de acuerdo a sus ingresos, en esta ocasión necesita ponerle puertas, ventanas y enverjado a su vivienda, para sentirse  segura ya que la zona donde habita hay mucha delincuencia.
texts.en:
Martha has been a single mother; she has always looked for a way to get ahead with her children by making tortillas. She opened a small grocery store, which helped a bit, but she also had to pay rent for the space so she can sell every day. Her two dependent children are students. 

Martha has applied for a loan to remodel her house, and the work is coming along slowly and depends on her income. She now needs to buy doors, windows, and bars for the house so that she can feel safe, as there is a lot of crime in the area.

loans.use: to buy doors, windows, and bars.

loans.name: Beulah

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Beulah works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming sugarcane. Beulah is borrowing 19,500 Philppines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle transport business.

Beulah has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream, which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her business.

loans.name: Jesús Salvador

texts.es:
Jesús de 46 años de edad, se caracteriza por se un hombre pujante. A pesar de las dificultades que ha tenido que afrontar debido a su condición económica, sigue adelante buscando mejores alternativas de vida. Hoy tiene una tienda gracias a su esfuerzo y años de trabajo, que le han permitido generar el sustento diario. En la actualidad su negocio se está acreditando, por lo cual, se encuentra solicitando un crédito, que invertirá en la compra de artículos de papelería y fotocopiadora, con el propósito de aumentar sus ventas y ser más competitivo en el mercado local.
Su mayor sueño es comprar el local en donde tiene ubicado su negocio con el fin de reducir gastos y garantizarle a su familiar mejores condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Jesús, 46, is a strong man. Despite the problems he has had to face due to his financial situation, he keeps looking for better life choices. He has a store now, thanks to his years of hard work, that allows him to support his family. The business is growing; therefore, he has applied for a loan to buy stationery items and a copier so that he can increase sales and be more competitive in the local market. His biggest dream is to buy a space for his business so that he can reduce costs and guarantee a better standard of living for his family.

loans.use: to buy stationery items and a copier.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 26 years old and has a live-in partner with two children. With one child currently in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 20,000 Phillipines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more items like shampoo, milk, laundry soap, coffee, noodles, and other groceries to sell in her general store.

Gina has been in this business for 2 years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, milk, laundry soap, coffee, noodles, and other groceries. She  would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items like shampoo, milk, laundry soap, coffee, noodles, and other groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Annabella

texts.en:
Annabella is 49 years old and married with 2 children.

Annabella works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a loan of 29,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to purchase more items like soft drinks, bread, biscuits, canned goods, and other groceries.

Annabella has borrowed and repaid 8 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 12 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Annabella aspires to save money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more items like soft drinks, bread, biscuits, canned goods, and other groceries.

loans.name: Edson

texts.en:
Edson is a 38-year-old married man with two children. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. His main business is farming, alongside running a drug shop to boost his income. 

He is facing hardships of inadequate capital to buy stock. However, he has a vision of building a permanent home, venturing into modern farming and owning a pharmacy. 

Edson intends to use the loan to buy drugs to sell.

loans.use: to buy drugs to sell.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine is 28 years old and married with one kid.

Christine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Christine has borrowed and repaid six loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and earns additional income from E-loading (mobile prepaid load).

Christine aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to construct a zero-grazing unit.

loans.name: Cecile

texts.en: Cecile is 48 years old. She sells vegetables and has been in the business for the past 10 years. She has requested the loan to buy more vegetables such as cassava leaves and green vegetables. She would like to use her profits from the business to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more vegetables such as cassava leaves and green vegetables to sell

loans.name: Loyce

texts.en:
Loyce is a 45-year-old mother from Komolo located in Homabay County. She is a widow and supports seven people in her family. She has seven children between 27 and 10 years old respectively.

She has a retail shop that she has been operating for the last eight years and comfortably makes a monthly income of KES 15,200. She is taking her second loan with KADET LTD, which she will use to increase the stock of goods like sugar, bar soap, cooking oil and maize flour. She will use the anticipated profit to plow back into the business.

Her dream is to have a stable business and help her family.

loans.use: To purchase items like sugar, salt, cooking oil and maize flour to sell

loans.name: Gloria Estela

texts.es:
Gloria tiene 62 años de edad, es madre soltera de cuatro hijos. Ella se acompaño a los 18 años de edad, procreando cuatro hijos en su hogar, posteriormente quedo viuda a los 30 años de edad. Comenta que durante estuvo con su esposo, ella se dedicaba a los oficios domésticos de su casa, pero desde que enviudo se dedico a trabajar ajeno, donde lavaba y planchaba, para seguir creciendo a su hijos, siendo ella padre y madre en su hogar y con tan mala suerte que por motivos de las lluvias se le derrumbo la casa, esto la llevo a solicitar un crédito, con el cual lo utilizo para comprar ropa y salir a vender a las calles realizando esta actividad durante 18 años, en todo este afán anduvo alquilando junto a sus hijos, y así poco a poco fue ahorrando y para hacer su casa de nuevo, cuando termino pensó en instalar una tienda y comprar productos de primera necesidad. Se puso también a vender conservas de coco, las cuales vendía cuando salía a vender con la venta de ropa, la tienda la tuvo solo cuatro años y el factor principal fue que por su buen corazón ella le daba fiado a la gente y esta nunca pago lo que consumió, por eso no siguió con la tienda.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundacion Campo, es para pagar la operación de uno de sus ojos, ya que presenta problemas de ceguera y si no se lo opera perderá la vista completamente por causa de la enfermedad; también ya se le ve afectado y en peligro su otro ojo con el que mira un poco mejor.


La necesidad que cubrirá será realizar la operación de su ojo, y recuperar la visión, a la vez evitara la perdida total de la vista y  de esta manera si se trata y todo sale bien volverá hacer una persona normal y seguir trabajando hasta que el señor le preste vida.
texts.en:
Gloria is 62 and the single mother of four children. She married at age 18, gave birth to her four children at home, and was widowed at age 30. While her husband was alive, she tended to the household chores; however, after he died, she worked outside her home, washing and ironing, so that she could raise her children. 

Being both mother and father and experiencing the bad luck of having her house destroyed by rains, she decided to apply for a loan. She used the loan to buy clothing to resell as a street vendor, work she has done now for 18 years. She continued renting with her children and slowly saving to build a new house, where she decided to set up a store and sell basic household items. She also sold coconut preserve as she traveled around selling clothing. Her store stayed open for four years, largely for the friendliness she showed her customers, but it never made a profit, and she had to close it. 

She has applied to Fundacion Campo for a loan to pay for surgery on one of her eyes; otherwise, she may lose her sight. Her other eye is also affected and in danger, though her vision in that eye is a bit better. The loan will meet her need for eye surgery to repair her sight and avoid going blind. If the operation goes well, she will see normally and be able to keep working as long as God allows.

loans.use: to pay for surgery on one of her eyes; otherwise, she may lose her sight.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila is 43 years old, married, and has five adult children. Lucila is from Carmen Annex, Ozamis City. Lucila operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. She has earned 6,000 PHP a month for years. 

In 2010, Lucila joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. Lucila is requesting a loan of 3,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase tires. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: To purchase tires

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Bernadette

texts.en:
Bernadette is 58 years old and married with three children.

Bernadette works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, spices, sugar, milk, coffee, etc.

Bernadette has borrowed and repaid 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and earns additional income from fishing.

She has successfully paid her previous loan and is now requesting an additional loan to build her general store and fishing business.

Bernadette aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like canned goods, spices, sugar, milk, coffee, etc

loans.name: John Jairo

texts.es:
Jhon Jairo de 52 años de edad, ha vivido toda su vida en el municipio de San Luis, Colombia. Desde hace algunos años decidió montar su propio negocio como medio de sostenimiento para su familia, compuesta por su esposa y su hijo.
Labora como independiente, en una pequeña cafetería que construyó con esfuerzo y sacrificio. En la actualidad su negocio es muy conocido, debido a su ubicación estratégica y a la calidad en el servicio. Su mayor sueño es ampliar su negocio con el fin de aumentar el número de clientes, razón por la cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en adecuaciones locativas y la compra de surtido.
Espera brindarle a su hijo el acceso a la educación superior.
texts.en:
Jhon Jairo, 52, has lived in de San Luis, Colombia, all his life. Some years age, he decided to open a business so that he could support his family, which comprises his wife and son. He works alone in a small cafeteria, which he build through hard work and sacrifice. His business is well known, due to its strategic location and good service.

His biggest dream is to expand his business so that he can service more customers; therefore, he has applied for a loan to remodel and buy inventory. He hopes to send his son to college.

loans.use: to remodel and buy inventory.

loans.name: Ivan

texts.es:
Ivan es un hombre de 30 años, es soltero, vive en la ciudad de Pisco, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven, Ivan no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Agronomía que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Chicharrones de Pescado para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Ivan trabaja como chofer brindando servicios de taxi en su ciudad, el cuenta con un auto propio el cual utiliza para trabajar, Ivan trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien porque conoce las zonas donde encontrar mayor cantidad de pasajeros.
Ivan se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar el mantenimiento general y la compra de amortiguadores para su taxi, de esta manera Ivan tendrá su herramienta de trabajo en mejores condiciones y podrá seguir brindando sus servicios, así pues el seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener otros autos para alquilarlos.
texts.en:
Ivan is 30, single, and lives in the city of Pisco. He is friendly, hardworking, enthusiastic, and focuses all his efforts on getting ahead. Ivan wasn't able to study agronomy in college because he lacked the money to go to school and had to start working at an early age. In his free time, he likes to watch movies, and he occasionally prepares a delicious pork rind and fish dish to share with his family. 

With dedication and on his own initiative, Ivan provides taxi service in his city. He owns the car he uses for work. Ivan works about 10 hours every day and feels that business is good because he knows where to find the most passengers.

Ivan thanks the Kiva lenders, whose support will allow him to do general maintenance and to buy shock absorbers for his taxi. Ivan's taxi will be in better shape, and he will be able to continue offering service, working, and striving to achieve his great dream of owning other cars to rent.

loans.use: to do general maintenance and to buy shock absorbers for his taxi.

loans.name: Naayem

texts.en:
Naayem is a 55-year-old married mother. She has two children who are still living under her roof. She owns her own small bakery where she prepares Lebanese traditional bread for the whole village. She has 21 years of experience in this domain, but she started her existing business in 2009. 

Her husband is a taxi driver and works as a house painter as an additional income, but both business incomes are not enough to provide for his entire family. Naayem has two children in a private school, which means she also has schooling expenses to settle on top of all the other expenses. Sending her children to school is very important for her because she wants them to have the opportunity that she unfortunately could not get, since the highest education she ever got was an intermediate school degree. 

Thus, improving her socioeconomic situation would help her keep her children in school, without it being a heavy burden on the family's shoulders. This is how she decided to contact Al Majmoua and acquire a loan. In fact, she needs to buy extra raw materials (flour, oil) at good prices that would increase her production and income in her bakery, and make necessary renovations to her working place. In the future, Naayem wishes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy extra raw materials (flour, oil) at good prices.

loans.name: Seraphine

texts.en: Seraphine is aged 38. She sells different items in her business. With the loan, she would like to buy more beauty soaps, rice, sugar and potatoes for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make more savings.

loans.use: To buy more beauty soaps, rice, sugar and potatoes for sale.

loans.name: Manny

texts.en: Manny is a hog-raiser. He is now 40 years old and married to Michele. Manny has been engaged in his business for two years. With his desire to increase his income and save for his family, Manny opted to avail a loan of 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos). If this loan will be granted, he plans to utilize it to buy feed, vaccines and medicines for his hogs. He hopes that he can obtain his desired loan to improve his business for him to give a better living to his family.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines and medicines for his hogs.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 57 years old, married and has three children.  

Evelyn is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Evelyn requested a 25,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Evelyn has been raising pigs for 10 years now, and has borrowed 19 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Jorge Iván

texts.es:
Jorge tiene más de 20 años de experiencia en mecánica automotriz, actividad que aprendió gracias a la oportunidad que le dieron de iniciar su vida laboral en un  pequeño taller cerca a su vivienda. Desde hace algunos años decidió independizarse y crear su propio taller en donde se dedica a la pintura y latonería de vehículos.
Con el fin de ofrecer un mejor servicio, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de herramientas y materiales. 
Espera garantizarle a su hijo de 16 años de edad, una buena educación y una mejor calidad de vida a su grupo familiar.
texts.en:
Jorge has more than 20 years of experience in automotive mechanics, a job he learned thanks to the opportunity he was given of beginning his work life in a small repair shop near his home.  Several years ago he decided to go out on his own and start his own shop, where paints automobiles and does body work.

He's requesting a loan to invest in buying tools and equipment so he can give better service.

He hopes to guarantee his 16-year-old son a good education and his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El cliente vive en Guayaquil. Comenzó su negocio hace varios años atrás ya que aprendió la profesión en un taller donde el trabajaba haciendo muebles de madera. 

Poco a poco siguió en su trabajo desde las 09:00am hasta las 18:00pm pero por su enfermedad ya que el es pvvs (persona viviendo con vih sida) tubo que dejar su negocio hasta ahora que quiere volver a reactivarlo ya que tiene algunas personas que desean sus muebles y desea mejorar sus ingresos.  

El hace muebles como cómodas, repisas, sillones, mesas etc. Por eso quiere el préstamo para comprar madera y pegamento y asi comenzar hacer muebles.
texts.en:
The client lives in Guayaquil.  He started his business several years ago.  He learned the profession in a workshop where he worked making wooden furniture.

Little by little he continued with his work from 9:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  Due to his illness; he is a PVVS (person living with HIV/AIDS), he had to leave his business.  He now wants to return to his business and reactivate it.  He has some people who want his furniture, and he wants to improve his income.

He makes furniture like dressers, shelves, easy chairs, and tables, etc.  Therefore, he wants to use the loan to buy wood and glue.  This way he will start making furniture.

loans.use: to buy wood and glue.

loans.name: Ximena Sirley

texts.es: La señora Ximena tiene 41 años,  ella se dedica  a la venta de comida, almuerzos y cena en su pequeña pensión que se encuentra en la zona de Primero de Mayo de la ciudad de EL Alto,  La señora Ximena es una persona muy trabajadora  y amable atiende muy bien a sus clientes ´razón por la cual su pensión es muy concurrida y también por la buena sazón de sus alimentos,  con el dinero del crédito comprara un frizer y mesas y sillas para brindar comodidad a su clientes, ya que está incrementando su clientela y por ende sus ingresos económicos, la Sra. Ximena se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito, el deseo de la Sra. es tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en:
Ximena, 41, makes a living selling food, lunches and dinner in her small business in the Primero de Mayo area of the city of El Alto.  Ximena's a very hardworking and friendly person who serves her customers very well.  Her place is very busy because of this and the good seasoning of her dishes.

With the money from the loan she'll buy a freezer as well as tables and chairs to make her customers comfortable, because she's increasing her clientele and consequently her income.

Ximena is happy, and she's grateful to the institution for the support from the loan.  Her desire is to have a big restaurant.

loans.use: to buy a freezer, tables, and chairs

loans.name: María Estefanía

texts.es:
María a sus 45 años de edad, es una guerrera llena de sueños por cumplir. Su familia es su mayor motivación y la razón que la motiva cada mañana. Desde hace algunos años decidió iniciar su proyecto de negocio, por lo cual montó un pequeño local en donde elabora desayunos, almuerzos y comercializa mecatos y refrescos.
Gracias a esta actividad esta mujer le brinda alimento, vivienda y educación a su familia. Sueña con expandir su negocio y convertirlo en una microempresa, para ello, se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de insumos para la preparación de alimentos. Espera que con esta inversión sus ingresos aumenten para garantizarles a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación.
texts.en:
María, at the age of 45, is a fighter who is full of dreams to accomplish. Her family is her greatest and constant motivation. Several years ago she decided to start her business project. She opened a small store where she makes breakfast and lunch and sells cakes and pop. 
Thanks to this job, this woman provides food, housing and education for her family. She dreams of expanding her business and converting it into a company, so she is requesting a loan which she will invest in the purchase of supplies for making food. She hopes that her income will increase with this investment in order to guarantee her children a better quality of life and a good education.

loans.use: to buy supplies for preparing food.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy household products.

loans.name: Irakli

texts.en:
Irakli is 30 years old. He lives in the capital city of Georgia, Tbilisi, with his wife and child. Irakli requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for a family business start-up, but without any success. His loan request was rejected all the time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

Irakli has a small commercial space in a very populous area, where he has opened a grocery shop. His wife is working in a beauty salon for a small daily income. 

Irakli requested a loan from Credo to start up a family business. He has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-start-up credits with soft conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of their low income. 

With his credit, Irakli will purchase stock of groceries for his grocery shop. He wants to expand the varieties of the products in his shop in order to offer better choices to his clients and satisfy their needs. This will attract more people and increase Irakli’s income. He will reinvest part of the profit in the same field and use another part for the family’s well-being. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase stock of groceries for his grocery shop.

loans.name: Angelina

texts.en:
This is Angelina, 43, resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Salvador, a mason, and they have children. She, together with her husband, manages their own household while operating the business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for her everyday expenses.

Angelina operates a video/karaoke shop. She provides a place in her house to be used by customers who want to rent the video/karaoke machine. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php500 in sales every day.

To help her continue operations of her business, she is requesting a Php33,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to pay for the maintenance of her video/karaoke machine. 

Angelina dreams to expand her business and hopes to have a good life. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the maintenance of her video/karaoke machine.

loans.name: Clementine

texts.en: Clementine is 39 years old. She owns a retail business with different items that she sells. With the loan, she would like to buy more potatoes, sugar and bananas for resale. The profits from the business will be used to pay the school fees for the children.

loans.use: To buy more potatoes, sugar and bananas for resale.

loans.name: Dilovar

texts.ru: Диловар житель города Нурек, расположенный в 70 км к юго-востоку от столицы страны города Душанбе. Диловар женат и является отцом двоих детей. Ему 28 лет. Он спокойный и предприимчивый мужчина. Диловар имеет высшее образование, но не работает по профессии. Диловар занимается услугой маршрутного такси. Он развозит пассажиров по нужному маршруту города. Диловар на протяжении семи лет продвигает свой бизнес. Получаемый доход он тратит на ежедневные семейные расходы. В данный момент Диловар обратился за кредитом. Он хочет отремонтировать свой рабочий автомобиль, а на отставшую сумму провести небольшой ремонт в доме.
texts.en: Dilovar lives in the city of Nurek, which is located 70km southwest of the capital city of Dushanbe.  He is 28 years old and is married with two children.  Dilovar is a gentle and enterprising man.  He has a higher education, but he does not work in that profession; he works as a taxi driver.  For seven years he has transported passengers on popular routes through the city.  He uses his income to help his family make ends meet.  Dilovar is asking for a loan because he wants to make repairs to his car, and he will use any leftover money to make some small repairs to his home.

loans.use: to make repairs to his car and his home

loans.name: Germania Maria

texts.es:
La cliente Germania vive en el Fortin. Ella tiene una pequeña tienda en la parte delantera de su casa, comenzo su negocio con un pequeño capital que tenia guardado ya que queria ayudar en los gastos del hogar. Poco a poco fue mejorando sus ingresos porla ventas que hacia en el sector ya que no habia muchas tiendas. 

En la actualidad trabaja desde las 06:00am hasta la noche cuando ya cierra su negocio. Vende en su tienda arroz, aceites, azúcar, enlatados, dulces ect. 

Tiene muchas aspiraciones con su negocio por eso quiere el préstamo para poder comprar Arroz, azúcar, aceite, enlatados  y así tener mas víveres para sus cliente que le comprar casi todos los días.
texts.en:
Germania lives in Fortin.  She has a small store in the front part of her house.  She started her business with a little capital that she had set aside because she wanted to help with the household expenses.  Little by little, her income was improving through the sales she made in the area.  This is because there were not a lot of stores.

She currently works from 6:00 a.m. until the evening, when she closes her business.  In her store she sells rice, cooking oil, sugar, canned goods, and candy, etc.

She has a lot of aspirations for her business.  Therefore, she wants the loan in order to be able to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, and canned goods.  That way she will have more foodstuffs for her customers, who buy from her almost every day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cooking oil, and canned goods.

loans.name: Juan Rafael

texts.es:
Juan a sus 22 años de edad, tiene claro que la gastronomía es la carrera que desea ejercer el resto de su vida, por lo cual busca cualquier oportunidad para alcanzar su sueño. Sabe que no tiene dinero, pero este no es un obstáculo para él. Asegura que las ganas son el principal elemento para llegar a la meta. Con el fin de pagar la capacitación en la elaboración de panes, e iniciar en el mundo laboral, Juan se encuentra solicitando un crédito, el cual reembolsara por cuotas. 
Sueña con ingresar a la universidad y graduarse como un gran chef de la alta cocina, dándose a conocer a nivel nacional e internacional.
texts.en:
Juan, 22, is certain that cooking is the career he wants to practice for the rest of his life, so he seeks out any opportunity to realize his dream.  He knows he has no money, but this presents no obstacle for him.  He's certain that desire is the main element for reaching his goal.

Juan's requesting a loan to pay for training in making bread and starting out in the working world.  He'll make payments to repay the loan.

He dreams of going to the university and graduating as a great chef of haute cuisine and being known nationally and internationally.

loans.use: to pay for training in making bread

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is the training grounds for many of Kenya's Olympic runners. She has 5 children and has been doing this work of farming for 13 years.  Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, crops and personal business.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Earning from agriculture.' Her biggest challenge: 'Financial access by small scale farmers is a challenge.' Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Chirwat.'

Mary was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'I joined Juhudi through a friend in a Juhudi group.'  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'I learned how Juhudi works to boost farmers' income through asset financing.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked, 'How will this loan benefit your family?', Mary replied, 'I will purchase a dairy cow to boost milk production.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Mary owns the following: 'cow, poultry' but does not own 'pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'mosquito net, TV' but does not have 'electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient and keeping costs down."

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Six Star Group

texts.en: This group is called Six Star and consists of four ladies who live in Taiz, Yemen. Eynas is 22 years old. She is a hardworking person who has gone through many adversities in her life. For this reason, she has always had great strength that has allowed her to get ahead. She is a sewer. Her business provides her with a source of household income and support. Because her work is recognized as being of good quality, she has acquired good customers recently. For this reason, she is requesting a youth loan of 15,000 YER to purchase sewing items so as to develop her business. Her dream is to be able to improve her household financial situation.

loans.use: to purchase sewing items so as to develop her business.

loans.name: Sandrine

texts.en: Sandrine is 28 years old. She sells onions and she is very proud of making more money in the business. She would like to buy more onions for resale using the new loan. The profits from the business will be used for making more savings.

loans.use: To buy more onions for resale.

loans.name: Dative

texts.en:
Dative is aged 28. She is married with four children; two of them go to school. 

She has requested the loan to buy more cooking oil, sugar and milk for sale. The profits from the business will be used to make savings for accumulating capital for the business.

loans.use: to buy more cooking oil, sugar and milk for sale.

loans.name: Linner

texts.en:
Linner lives in the Litein area of Kenya. She has five children and has been doing this work (farming) for five years.  Her primary income sources are milk, tea and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: “Digging”. Her biggest challenge is, “inadequate funds.” Animals on the farm have been given the names of “Lelkina”.

Linner was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied, “Low interest rates on (the) loan.” This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi's required microfinance training session and replied, “It processes loans faster.”

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked, “How will this loan benefit (your) family?”, Linner replied, “Will boost income for the family.”

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Linner owns a cow and poultry, but does not own a pig, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household a mosquito net, but does not have electricity, solar power, running water, sewing machine, TV,  or DVD.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to construct a zero-grazing unit.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es:
El cliente vive en la ciudad de Guayaquil. El comenzó sus servicios de electricista hace unos 10 años atras ya que donde estudio en la secundaria le enseñaron esta profesión. Poco a poco fue obteniendo clientela y mejorando sus servicios de electricista.    

En la actualidad trabaja desde las 08:30am hasta las 18:00pm todos los días en una construcción ya que los trabajos que tiene son por contrato. Una de sus dificultades es su discapacidad ya que no tiene una pierna y utiliza una prótesis para poder trabajar como electricista. 

A pesar de su impedimento el es un hombre trabajador por eso quiere el préstamo para poder comprar tres computadoras ya que tiene un proyecto de instalar un cyber en la parte delantera de su casa y asi tener otro ingreso y no solo el de electricista.
texts.en:
The client lives in the city of Guayaquil.  He started providing his electrician services ten years ago.  They taught him this profession where he went to high school.  He was getting clientele little by little, and he was improving his electrician services.

He currently works from 8:30 a.m. until 6:00 p.m. every day at a construction site.  The jobs that he has are by contract.  One of his difficulties is his disability.  He is missing a leg, and he uses a prosthesis in order to be able to work as an electrician.

In spite of his impediment, he is a hard-working man.  Therefore, he wants to use the loan to be able to buy three computers.  He has a project of installing a cyber cafe in the front part of his house.  This way he will have another income in addition to that of being an electrician.

loans.use: to buy three computers.

loans.name: Eduarda

texts.es: La socia Eduarda nació en la ciudad de Izcamarca pero vive en la comunidad de Pilco – Grande, ella tiene 48 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene siete hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura, a la ganadería y a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, chanchos y etc. Ella requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes. Ella está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas. (La ciudad de Pilco - Grande está ubicada en el distrito de Challabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el  departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Eduarda was born in the city of Izcamarca but lives in the community of Pilco-Grande. She is 48 and in a common-law relationship; together they have seven children. She works in agriculture, with livestock and raising small animals such as guinea pigs, hens, pigs, etc.
She needs this loan for the purchase of small animals such as guinea pigs. She is happy to have this loan and promises to repay her quotas.
(The city of Pilco - Grande is located in the district of Challabamba, within the province of Paucartambo in the department of Cusco, Peru.)

loans.use: to buy small animals such as guinea pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to get basic cooking training.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en: Aida earns a living through her sari-sari or variety store. She sells various goods ranging from food products to cleaning agents. Ada lives with her family and her five children in the town of Bien Unido, Bohol. Aida is asking for a loan to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods. With this, she will be able to attract more customers to her store, thus augmenting her sales and income.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like canned goods, candies, noodles, soap and toiletries, biscuits and snack foods.

loans.name: Majani Ya Chai Group

texts.en:
ZENA, who is in her early 40s, is married with three children who go to school. She has been running several businesses: decorations, cosmetics and catering services. She works from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be  ZENA's 4th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to buy serving dishes, chairs, about 200 nice plates and to restock the missing items in all her businesses.  She has paid back all her loans successfully.  She used the profit to pay school fees and to cover household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy more cosmetics to resell.  She dreams of building her own house.
