Johnson's life will improve as these savings can be used to start up other income-generating projects as well as facilitate repayment of the loan.

The slurry, a byproduct of biogas, will be very helpful in growing fodder for his animals so he will not have to spend money on buying fertilizer as well.

He is really grateful that he is able to build a biodigester that he could not afford without a credit facility.

loans.use: to construct a biodigester

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a single mother of two girls in secondary school living in Kirinyaga county in central Kenya. She has a coffee and tea farm and also practices dairy farming. She has three cows from which she sells around 20 liters of milk per day. 

Her farm income is used for her children's school fees and for their daily needs. Because she does not have electricity at home, she uses kerosene for light and firewood and charcoal for cooking. These fuel expenses cost her approximately $57 per month.

To save her this amount of money, VEP recommended that she install a biodigester at her home. The biodigester will produce gas that she will use for cooking and lighting. After receiving training, she took a loan, and a biodigester is now under construction at her home.

Gladys and her family will have a better life free from the drudgery of collecting firewood and using smoky kitchens.

loans.use: To construct a biodigester

loans.name: Dúo Getzemani Group

texts.es:
DUO GETZEMANI
Es integrada por las señoras María Felipa de 58 años de edad originaria del Municipio de San Juan Sacatepéquez, doña Felipa es madre de familia tiene una niña de 16 años de edad, desde ya hace más de 25 años doña Felipa se ha dedicado a la venta de ropa, tejido de servilletas, y elaboración de costura en los cortes típicos de  su localidad, de esta manera ella ha logrado mantener su pequeño hogar,es asi como ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion de tejidos tipicos para la venta.
texts.en:
One of the two members of the Getzemani group is 58-year old María Felipa, a native of the municipality of San Juan Sacatepéquez. She has a 16-year old daughter. For more than 25 years Sra. Felipa has sold clothing and woven napkins, and made the traditional dress typical of the area. Through these activities she has managed to maintain her small house.

This loan will allow her to buy the fabric and weaving supplies she needs to make traditional clothing to sell.

loans.use: buy fabric and weaving supplies to make traditional clothing

location.town: Aldea Cruz Blanca San Juan Sacatepequez

loans.name: Husein

texts.en:
Husein is a 25 year-old, single man, who has worked in agriculture for two years. He has a tractor which he uses for ploughing agricultural land. His business is in high demand in his region since most of his regional citizens work in agriculture and request a fast service, which he can provide. He also sells water to irrigate the land with the help of a small container attached to his tractor.

Husein is applying for a Youth loan from Kiva's partner Al Majmoua, in order to change his tractor's tyres, because it is very important to have them in good shape to do his work easily.

In the future, he hopes to be able to buy all the necessary agricultural tools to reply to any special request from local farmers.

loans.use: to change his tractor's tyres.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en:
Shehnaz is a 35-year-old married woman and a mother of three. She has been running a business of selling bed covers and sofa covers for the past 5 years. She purchases a wide variety of bed sheets and covers from the main city and then sells them to the people in her vicinity. She has a number of customers and is able to generate enough income to fulfill the demands of her family members. 

At present, Shehnaz is requesting a loan of Rs. 25,000 to purchase bed covers, spreads and sofa covers in different designs and colors by taking into account the taste and choice of her customers. She is in her 3rd loan cycle with good repayment history. This loan will help her to generate more income which she will use to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase bed covers, spreads and sofa covers in different designs and colors.

loans.name: Fredrick

texts.en:
Fredrick is a 42-year-old man from Shienwe location in Kakamega county. He supports six people in his family. He is married to Mildred who is also a business lady within the same town. Fredrick has six children who are 18, 15, 12, 9, 6 and 1 year old respectively.

He has a general store where he sells general goods like ropes, mats and baskets. He has been operating this kind of business for the last 13 years and generates a monthly income of about KES 20,000. 

Fredrick is taking his first loan from KADET LTD, which he will use to purchase more stock of ropes, baskets and plastic plates for resale. He will plow the anticipated profit back into the business.

His dream is to expand his business and become stable so as to support his family's needs.

loans.use: To buy ropes, baskets and plastic plates.

loans.name: Alianne

texts.en: Alianne is 32 years old. She owns a retail business, selling different items. With the loan, she would like to add more rice, soaps and sugar for resale. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: To buy more rice, soaps and sugar for resale.

loans.name: Joise

texts.en:
Joise is a 51-year-old married woman. Five years ago she started a business of selling fabric in her community. She buys different fabrics in various colors and designs from the market at wholesale rates and then sells them in her area. She works day and night to improve the living conditions of her family. She makes enough revenue to meet the daily demands of her family. 

She applied for a loan of Rs 20,000 to buy different fabrics such as lawn and chiffon, according to her customers' demands. She believes that this loan will be helpful in business expansion and wishes to spend part of revenue on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy different fabrics such as lawn and chiffon, according to customers' demands.

loans.name: Valence

texts.en: Valence is 42 years old. He is married with three children. He would like to buy engine oil for use in his transport business. He has been running this business for eight years. He plans to use the profits for building a house.

loans.use: To buy engine oil for resale.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Ms Shamim is a 41-year-old lady. She has been running her tailoring business for the past eight years. She is expert in stitching stylish dresses for the ladies of her community.  Her husband is a barber whose income is not sufficient to meet the needs of the family alone. That is why Shamim is working hard to provide her six children with good quality food, health and education. 

Due to the lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers so she applied for a loan of Rs. 25,000 to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of laces and zippers. She is currently in her 2nd loan cycle and has shown good repayment behavior.

loans.use: to buy reels of threads in different colors along with packs of laces and zippers.

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk-producing area. Margret has three children and she has been doing dairy work for three years. Her primary income sources are milk and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "milking." Her biggest challenge is: "feeding my animals." Animals on the farm have been given the names of: "Cheboit."

Margret was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: "training on credit management."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi Kilimo's required microfinance training session: "record-keeping."

Her highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked, "How will this loan benefit your family?," Margret replied, "I will get milk to feed my family."

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Margret owns the following: 'cow, poultry, bicycle,' but does not own: 'pig, pump, motorcycle, automobile.' Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household: 'mosquito net, solar power, TV,' but does not have: 'electricity, running water, sewing machine, DVD'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Mumo

texts.en:
Mumo is married and they are blessed with 10 children. They live at their own house that has no electricity or piped water. His greatest monthly expense is school fees and food for the family.

He operates a goat meat selling business. He cites seasonality and stiff competition from other operators to be his major challenges. 

With the Kshs 40,000 he wants to purchase 5 goats for resale to meet the needs of his clients and to ensure the continuous productivity of the business. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase 5 goats for resale to meet the needs of his clients and ensure continuous productivity.

loans.name: Joselyne

texts.en: Joselyne is age 39. She is married with four children. With the loan, she would like to buy more quantities of honey for resale. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: To buy more honey for resale.

loans.name: Epiphanie

texts.en:
Epiphanie is 28 years old. She sells meat and has been in the business for nine years. She has four children; two of them go to school. 

The loan Epiphanie has requested will be used to buy more meat for sale at the butcher shop. The profits from the business will be used to build a house.

loans.use: to buy more meat to sell.

loans.name: Rosa Lucia

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 27 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Ica, en el distrito de Parcona con sus padres, a quienes ama y agradece todo su apoyo, Rosa es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por salir adelante; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad de trabajar, Rosa no ha podido estudiar la carrera profesional de Administración de Empresas que desea, en sus ratos libres le gusta escuchar música y en algunas ocasiones cocina unos riquísimos Tallarines Rojos para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Rosa trabaja como cajera en un internet de su ciudad, ella brinda servicios de atención al cliente, trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, Rosa se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Rosa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias  a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de una cocina, ya que actualmente cuenta con una cocina a kerosene que presenta desperfectos y su uso es peligroso, de esta manera ella y su familia tendrán mayor seguridad y bienestar al preparar sus alimentos, así pues Rosa seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de poder estudiar una carrera profesional.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 27 year old young woman, and she is single.  She lives in the city of Ica in the Parcona district with her parents, whom she loves very much.  She is grateful for all of their support.  Rosa is a very kind, hard-working, and enthusiastic person.  She puts all of her efforts into getting ahead.  Sadly, due to the lack of financial resources and the need to work, Rosa was not able to study the business administration profession that she would have liked to.  In her free time she likes to listen to music.  Sometimes she makes the delicious ‘Tallarines Rojos’ [similar to spaghetti] to share with her family.

On her own initiative, and with great determination and dedication, Rosa works as a cashier at an internet cafe in her city.  She provides customer services, and she works every day.  She starts at the very early hours of the morning, and she is able to work for approximately ten hours.  Rosa likes doing her work, and she believes that it is going well for her due to the kind way that she treats others.

Rosa is very grateful to the Kiva lenders.  Thanks to the help they have provided, she will be able to buy a stove.  She currently has a kerosene stove, which is damaged, and using it is dangerous.  This way she and her family will be safer and better off when preparing their food.  This way Rosa will continue working and putting forth great effort in order to fulfill her big dream of being able to study for a professional career.

loans.use: to buy a stove.

loans.name: Manuel Arturo

texts.es:
Manuel, vive con su compañera de vida, disfruta de dos hijos, los cuales tienen edades de 4 y 10 años. El, se dedica a las  la cultivo de granos básicos tales como: maíz y frijol, lo realiza desde hace 15 años, todos los días de 6:00am a 3:00pm, hasta el momento no presenta ninguna dificultad.
El préstamo que requiere le permitirá comprar abono, herbicidas, insecticidas, pesticidas, plaguicidas, entre otros; este le ayudara a tener los insumos agrícolas necesarios en el momento oportuno para llevar a cabo el cultivo.
Su sueño es ayudar a sus hijos en sus estudios y brindarle una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Manuel lives with his life partner and he has two children aged 4 and 10. He has been engaged in planting basic grains such as corn and beans for 15 years, working every day from 6 am to 3 pm, and up to now he has not encountered any difficulties.
The loan he is requesting will be used to buy manure, weed killers, insecticides, pesticides, pest-control substances and other supplies; this will help him having all the farming supplies he needs right where he needs them for the full growth of his crops.
He dreams of helping his children with their studies and of granting a better standard of living to his family.

loans.use: To buy manure, weed killers, insecticides, pesticides and pest-control substance.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Nasreen is a 31-year-old married woman. She lives with her husband and four children, two of whom are school-going. The man shown in the picture is Nasreen’s husband.  They have been running a business of agriculture for many years to improve the living conditions of their family. They grow and harvest seasonal vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market on a daily basis. They sell fresh fruits and vegetables, and that’s why their demands are increasing day by day. 

Now Nasreen is asking for a loan of Rs. 30,000 to buy different types of seeds along with packs of insecticides and pesticides. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with Kashf foundation. She hopes that this new loan will allow her to generate more revenue for having better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy different types of seeds as well as packs of insecticides and pesticides.

loans.name: Justine

texts.en:
Justine  is widowed with two children. One of her children goes to school. Justine also takes care of additional family members (old mother). 

She has a business of a retail shop and has been in this business for ten years. She has applied for a loan of UGX 2,800,000 (Uganda shillings) from Micro Credit for Development and Transformation SACCO (MCDT SACCO) to buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap, bags of rice, blue band, wheat flour, and maize flour. 

Justine generates additional income through farming. She works in a shop and sells both retail and wholesale, seven days out of every week. Her major business challenges include seasonality and ever-increasing prices of commodities in Uganda. 

Justine aspires to own a big supermarket and also to build rental rooms. She resides in her own house and the family has access to electricity, but no piped water. Her monthly expenses include rent for her business premises and school fees for her child.

loans.use: to buy more bags of sugar, boxes of soap, bags of rice, blue band, wheat flour, and maize flour to sell in her shop.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is a married man blessed with seven children. All of his children attend school. He and his family live in their own house, which has no electricity or piped water.

To earn a living, he has operated a meat (goat) selling business for over five years. He operates his business at the market, where neighbors are his customers. He notes that the main business challenge he faces is stiff competition in the area.

With the requested loan in the amount of 50,000 KES, he wants to purchase 12 goats for re-sale. He believes that the loan will help him expand his business and earn additional income to better support his family. He aspires to open his own store for easier operations.

loans.use: to expand and improve his business by purchasing 12 goats for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Goderdzi

texts.en:
Goderdzi is 47 years old. He lives in the small village of Gurjaani District with his wife, son, daughter-in-law and grandson.

On several occasions, Goderdzi requested loans from local financial institutions for a family business start-up, each time without any success. His loan requests were rejected every time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions.

Goderdzi works as an artisan and earns a modest monthly income. His wife works locally as a baker. Their earnings provide hardly enough income to purchase food for the family. According to Credo estimates, their family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Goderdzi requested a loan from Credo for a start-up family business. Goderdzi has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions providing business start-up and re-startup credits with lenient conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as high-risk borrowers because of their low incomes.

With the loan proceeds that he is requesting, Goderdzi would like to begin trading livestock. Specifically, he plans to purchase calves, and to raise and re-sell them at higher prices for profits. He believes that such an operation would significantly increase his family's income. And, as a result, he feel that the new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: to start a livestock trading business by purchasing calves and later raising and re-selling them at higher prices

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is married and has children who attend school. Mercy has had a home-based grocery store for years. Aside from the usual grocery items, she also sells cooked chapati (flat bread) that generates extra income, especially on the weekend. She’s requesting this loan to buy rice, sugar, flour, and noodles at wholesale.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, flour, and noodles at wholesale

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa propia con su familia, el se dedica a la agricultura, a la siembra de maíz y maicillo. Se ha dedicado a esta actividad durante varios años y es así como se gana el pan de cada día. Él es un hombre trabajador, responsable y muy conocido en la zona por su enorme corazón y amabilidad para con los demás. Debido a que ya es temporada de siembra tomo la decisión de comenzar a prepararse. Es por esa razón que ha decidido solicitar este nuevo crédito a INTEGRAL para invertir en la compra de semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc. Lo que más desea es que su cosecha sea abundante y mejor que las anteriores, ya que esta es la forma en que él consigue el sustento para su familia.  Confía en Dios que con su ayuda, su dedicación y empeño en el  trabajo lograra el sueño de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
The client lives with his family in his own house.  He is a farmer, and he grows corn and sorghum.  He has been engaged in this business activity for several years.  This is how he earns his daily bread.  He is a hard-working and responsible man.  He is very well-known in the area for his enormous heart and his kindness to others.

Because it is now the planting season, he made the decision to begin preparing.  That is why he has decided to request a new loan from Integral.  He will use the loan to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, etc.  What he wants the most is for his harvest to be abundant and to be better than the previous ones.  This is the way that he supports his family.  He trusts in God, that with his help, and his dedication and determination in his work, he will fulfill his dream of improving his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, etc.

loans.name: Zahava

texts.en:
Thanks in part to her first loan, Zahava's cosmetic salon is doing well. She was able to repay her first loan early and wants to further expand and upgrade her salon.

Zahava has succeeded in attracting a good flow of customers and seeing her business improve. She is now working to further professionalize her business by purchasing an expert peeling machine and additional cosmetic supplies. In addition, she is also moving ahead with publicity and a website for the business. She wants to continue to grow and manage her business with success.

loans.use: To expand and improve her salon by purchasing a special peeling machine and cosmetic supplies and by advertising (e.g., publicity through a website).

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase building materials, a hair washing station, chairs, a treatment table, and cosmetic supplies

loans.name: Rosine

texts.en: Rosine is 26 years old and single. She has run a canteen for the past four years. She has requested a loan to buy more fresh milk and soda to sell. She plans to use the profits to increase her savings.

loans.use: to buy more milk and soda to sell

loans.name: Constance

texts.en:
Constance lives in Kisauni, is married, lives in her own home, and has children. She works hard and tirelessly to be able to give them everything that they need to have a good life without privations.

Constance has been the owner of a food store for the past year. This couple works hard for their family, and they are asking for the opportunity to continue to grow. She is asking for a loan for the purchase of inputs for the store. She wants to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar. She is grateful for the opportunity she has been given, since this will be of great help.

loans.use: to purchase wheat flour, maize flour, rice, and sugar

loans.name: Theodore

texts.en: Theodore is 25 years old. He is single and sells various items in his boutique. He would like to buy more rice, sugar, and cooking oil to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy more rice, sugar, and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Oumar

texts.fr: Monsieur Oumar est un natif du quartier qui évolue dans le commerce de baches, poutres et toiles. Il est marié et père de famille. Il a une expérience de 10ans dans son activité, Oumar gère les charges de la familles telles que les dépenses quotidiennes et les frais de scolarité.Monsieur Oumar sollicite ce pret d'un montant de 500 000F pour acheter des baches, poutres et toiles qu'il va revendre à ses clients. Durant la période de la saison des pluies les baches et toiles sont très sollicités pour la couverture des toits. Il commence sa journée à 8h pour quitter le marché à 19h. A l'avenir il souhaite augmenter ses revenus avec l'aide de l'IMCEC et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille.
texts.en: Monsieur Oumar grew up in the quarter in which he sells tarpaulin, beams and canvas for a living. He is married with children. He has worked in his field for 10 years. Oumar looks after the family's needs, such as daily expenditures and school fees. Monsieur Oumar is seeking a loan of 500,000 F in order to purchase tarpaulin, beams and canvas which he sells to his customers. During the rainy season the tarpaulin and canvas is in high demand for use in roof covering. Monsieur Oumar begins his day at 8am and finishes at 7pm. In future he would like to boost his revenues with the help of IMCEC, and improve his family's living standards.

loans.use: to purchase tarpaulin, beams, and canvas for re-sale, primarily in winter

loans.name: Camilo

texts.es: Camilo de 48 años de edad, habita al sur de la ciudad con su cónyuge y su hija de 24 años. Con una experiencia de 28 años de trabajar en una industria de productos capilares, enfocó su idea de negocio hacia la comercialización de cremas, champo, enjuagues etc. y haciendo cursos técnicos logró aprender y perfeccionar la preparación de los mismos. Sus principales productos son la cremas para alisar,  neutralizantes, siliconas, los cuales distribuye entre su clientela que ha logrado vendiéndole sus productos puerta a puerta y en la modalidad de crédito y de contado. En la actualidad requiere vender en mayor volumen y su capital de trabajo no es suficiente para responder a la demanda y por eso se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para acceder a su primer crédito, mediante el cual comprará materias primas e insumos como glicerinas, colorantes, botellas y tapas para aumentar su producción y vender mucho mas. Con ello sus compras se aumentarán, por el volumen obtenido y sus costos de producción se disminuirán y esta es justamente la razón por la cual su credikiva será exitoso.
texts.en: Camilo is 48 years old, and he lives in the southern area of his town with his wife and their daughter, aged 24. Having spent 28 years working for a hair products company, he has focused his business idea on selling creams, shampoos, rinses and so on. He has attended a few technical courses, thus succeeding in learning and perfecting their production. His mainly produces sleeking creams, neutralizers and silicone which he sells to the customers he has gained by selling his products door to door on credit and as well as for cash. He currently wants to sell bigger quantities, but his working capital is not enough to meet his customers’ requests; for this reason he has come to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to ask for his first loan. He will use it to buy supplies and ingredients such as glycerin, coloring, bottles and lids to increase his production and sell more products. This will increase the volume of sold products, so that his production costs will diminish, and this is the reason why his loan will be profitable.

loans.use: To buy glycerin, coloring, bottles and lids.

loans.name: Nino

texts.en:
Nino is 51 years old. She lives in Gurjaani District with her husband, two children, daughter-in-law and grandson.

On several occasios, Nino requested loans from local financial institutions for family business start-ups, each time without any success. Her loan requests were rejected every time because of her low income and her family’s poor living conditions.

The only source of income for the family is her husband's and son's monthly salaries. Both of them work as salesmen. But their earnings provide hardly enough income to put food on the table for the family. According to Credo estimates, the family belongs to the subsistence poor category.

Nino requested a loan from Credo for a start-up family business. Nino has now been approved for a loan within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisions providing business start-up and re-startup credits with lenient conditions to rural poor people, who do not have access to credit products. These rural poor people are regarded as high-risk borrowers because of their low incomes.

With the loan proceeds that she is requesting, Nino would like to begin trading used clothing. Specifically, she plans to purchase used clothing from the wholesalers in Tbilisi, the capital city of Georgia, and to then re-sell such clothing in Gurjaani at higher prices. She believes that, by doing so, she will increase her family's income. And in this way, she feels that the new business initiative, financed with the Kiva start-up loan, will significantly improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to begin buying and selling used clothing

loans.name: Maia

texts.en: Maia is a 36-year-old married woman with 1 child. She makes and sells food in her community to earn a living. She has just decided to operate a food stall business selling pork cake, donuts, mince pie, and ice cake, but she has been cooking and baking for many years. Maia needs a loan to buy ingredients such as flour, cooking oil, mutton flaps, sacks of onions, salt, soya, foam cups, cordial, sugar, and garlic for her business. She plans to use her profits to support her family and to maintain her business. Maia has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy food ingredients for her business

loans.name: Adonay

texts.es: Adonay de 65 años de edad, desde hace muchos años se dedica a cultivar la tierra.  Con mucha dedicación cultiva maíz y sorgo, lo cual le permite llevar el  pan de cada día a su hogar. Se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, honrado y responsable. Habita junto a su  grupo familiar el cual está conformado por su esposa y sus tres hijos de 16, 15 y 11 años de edad. Junto a su esposa trabajan muy duro para sacar adelante a su familia y darles mejores condiciones a las que ellos han tenido. Gracias a los conocimientos en la agricultura es como logra llevar el sustento a su hogar, que es su principal fuente de ingresos, dado que es la única forma que conoce para ganarse la vida honradamente. Con muchos deseos de superación se acerco a esta institución para solicitar crédito ya que la temporada para la siembra comenzó y es necesario iniciar la siembra lo antes posible. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita el crédito ya que necesita invertir en la compra de los insumos agrícolas necesarios como: semillas, abonos, insecticidas, etc. para la siembra. Confía en Dios y en su trabajo que de esta forma logrará  tener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá acceder a una mejor calidad de vida para él y su familia.
texts.en:
Adonay, age 65, has been cultivating the land for many years.  He grows corn and sorghum with great dedication.  This allows him to bring home the daily bread to his household.  He is known for being a hard-working, honest, and responsible man.  He lives with his family, which is comprised of his wife and their three children, ages 16, 15, and 11.  Together with his wife, they work very hard in order to get their family ahead and to give them better living conditions than what they had.

Thanks to his knowledge of farming, he manages to support his household.  It is his main source of income, given that it is the only way he knows to earn an honest living.

With a great desire for improvement, he approached the institution in order to request a loan.  This is because planting season has started, and he needs to start planting as soon as possible.  That is the reason he is requesting the loan.  He needs to buy the agricultural supplies like seeds, fertilizers, and insecticides, etc. in order to plant.

He trusts in God and in his work that this way he will manage to have an abundant harvest.  The harvest will allow him to access a better quality of life for himself and for his family.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers, herbicides and insecticides, etc

loans.name: Osinatu

texts.en:
This is 49-year-old Osinatu. She is married and has two children, ages 19 and 15. In 1994, Osinatu established her clothing and textiles business. She began her business just to generate enough cash to support her children and this is her only source of livelihood. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 600,000 every month from this business. 

Osinatu would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Osinatu requires a loan in order to buy window cotton, obama wax, and simple lace and guarantee wax. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. In the future, Osinatu plans to educate her kids, to develop her plot of land, and to rent a shop. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy window cotton, obama wax, and simple lace and guarantee wax.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy cosmetics, clothes, shoes, etc.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es: Félix, de 45 años de edad , está casado y tiene 7 hijos a los que cuida con mucho amor y cariño en la casa que compraron hace 17 años.La zona donde habita, es un paraje alejado, que aparte de poseer un buen paisaje tiene tierras muy fértiles. Desde muy joven comenzó su camino por la agricultura, aprovechando las cualidades de la tierra. Ya tiene 5 años de experiencia en los sembríos de habas, alverja, papa y maíz, los cuales cuida constantemente, ya que necesita de los nutrientes necesarios para poder adquirir productos de calidad. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es poder ver crecer los alimentos de la tierra, pero le molesta las variaciones constantes que existe en el mercado, por lo que a veces no sabe si obtendrá buenas ganancias. Pero eso no lo desanima ya que comenzó con la crianza de animales menores como chanchos y gallinas, los cuales vende a buen precio después de engordarlos. Además de tener compradores fijos en el mercado mayorista de la ciudad.Félix, invertirá los S/.2500 soles en la compra de abono orgánico para nutrir sus sembríos.
texts.en: Félix is 45 years old, he is married and he has 7 children whom he cares for with deep love and affection in the house he bought 17 years ago. He lives in a secluded area, blessed with beautiful landscapes as well as rich soils. He started his path on agriculture since he was very young, taking advantage of the good quality if the lands. He presently counts on a 5-years’ experience in planting broad beans, peas, potatoes and corn; he cares for his crops constantly because they need the proper nourishment to obtain good quality products. Being able to watch products growth on his land is what he mostly likes about his job; what he doesn't like are the constant changes in market prices, as at times he doesn’t know whether he will earn a good income. However, this does not discourage him because on top of counting on fixed customers in the wholesalers’ market of his town, he has also started breeding small animals such as pigs and chickens, which he sells for a good price after having fattened them. Félix will invest the 2500 PEN in the purchase of manure to feed his crops.

loans.use: To buy manure.

loans.name: Caminando Hacia Al Progreso 1 & 7 Group

texts.en:
Leocadia is one of the members of the group Caminando Hacia el Progreso (Walking to the Future) 1 & 7. This group is located in a rural community surrounded by sugarcane fields on the outskirts of San Pedro de Macoris, where the group's members sell various products like foods, clothes, shoes, etc.

Leocadia makes her home in a simple structure with her long-term partner and their three children. For the past five years she has operated a fruit and vegetable stall where, in addition to fruits and vegetables she sells meat, charcoal, etc. She started her business with her own savings.

Leocadia is excited to be a part of this loan, her 10th with Esperanza after having repaid her previous loan portions and grown her business. She plans to use this loan to invest in her business inventory by buying plantains, onions, cassava, bananas, oranges, chickens, coriander, greens products, etc.

Leocadia says that her most difficult challenges are improving her business and helping her family. She thanks you all for your support!!!

loans.use: To buy vegetables, meat, fruits and other goods.

loans.name: Dionicia Amanda

texts.es: La socia Zenobia nació en la ciudad de Pilco – Grande y vive en la misma ciudad donde nació, ella tiene 32 años de edad y tiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene seis hijos, ella se dedica a la agricultura y también a la crianza de animales menores como por ejemplo cuyes, gallinas, chanchos y otros, ella requiere el préstamo para comprar animales menores como cuyes y gallinas, ella está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de sus cuotas. (La comunidad de Pilco – Grande está ubicado en el distrito de Huayllabamba dentro de la provincia de Paucartambo en el  departamento de Cusco, Perú).
texts.en:
Zenobia was born in the city of Pilco-Grande, and she lives in the same city where she war born.  She is 32 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has six children.

She works in agriculture, and she also raises small animals like guinea pigs, chickens, pigs, and others.

She needs the loan to buy small animals like guinea pigs and chickens.  She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments.

(The Pilco-Grande community is in the Huayllabamba district in the Paucartambo province, Cusco department, Peru.)

loans.use: to buy small animals like guinea pigs and chickens.

loans.name: Matainofo

texts.en: Matainofo is a 28-year-old married woman with one child. She runs a plantation business which has been in operation for many years. Matainofo is requesting a loan to assist her in purchasing chemicals and fertiliser for improving her plantation; iron roofing, timber, nails and cement to help with her home renovation; and school uniforms for her child. Matainofo hopes to maintain her plantation business and use some of the profits to assist with her family's daily needs.

loans.use: To buy chemicals, fertiliser, timber, cement, iron roofing, nails, and school uniforms.

loans.name: Martina Elena

texts.es: Doña Martina de 48 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hijo, doña Martina es muy responsable y quien tiene como prioridad principal sacar adelante a su familia. Ella posee una venta de tortillas, en la cual se encarga de elaborar cada mediodía y cada noche. Su negocio esta ubicado en su casa de habitación. Martina  desea mucho poder mejorar su negocio, ya que este brinda ganancias muy estables, lo cual le permite sostener a su familia, es por esto que solicita un préstamo por medio del cual pueda comprar maíz por mayor y cal, esto para elaborar mayor cantidad de tortillas, sobre todo los fines de semana que su demanda se incrementa debido a que muchas otras tortillerías están cerradas y asi ella pueda obtener mayores ganancias las cuales le permitan mejorar su estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Martina, who is 48 years old, lives with her husband and son. Martina is very responsible, and her main priority is providing for her family. She owns a tortilla stand, where she makes tortillas every midday and every night. Her business is located in her home. 

Martina really wants to improve her business, because it provides her with a very stable income, which allows her to support her family. That is why she is requesting a loan, so that she can purchase wholesale corn and lime in order to make larger quantities of tortillas, especially on the weekends when demand increases due to many other tortilla shops being closed. This will allow her to obtain a higher profit, which in turn will help her gain more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy wholesale corn and lime.

loans.name: Taua

texts.en:
Taua is 26 years old and married with three children. She wants to start a small business making and selling popcorn in her community. 

To do this, she needs a loan to buy popcorn, oil, an oven, plastic bags, salt, and kerosene. 

In the future,Taua hopes to earn more profit to improve her business, and to help her children's education. 

She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy popcorn, oil, an oven, plastic bags, salt, and kerosene for her popcorn business.

loans.name: Marc

texts.en:
Marc is thirty years old and has three children aged between three and six years. He runs a music business.

Marc is applying for a 500,000 RWF loan through Urwego Opportunity Bank to buy a laptop for use in his music business. He plans to use the profits for paying school fees.

loans.use: to buy a laptop for use in his music business.

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
Rosa es una mujer de 24 años, es soltera, vive en la ciudad de Camaná con sus padres y hermanos, ella es una persona muy amable, trabajadora y entusiasta, que tiene un gran deseo de superación; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar a sus padres, Rosa no ha podido estudiar una carrera profesional, en sus ratos libres le gusta ver películas y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Pollo Frito para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Rosa trabaja en su pequeño negocio de de venta y alquiler de trajes de noche, ella trabaja en un pequeño centro comercial donde alquila vestidos, zapatos, carteras y otros, Rosa trabaja todos los días desde tempranas horas de la mañana y puede hacerlo por un aproximado de 10 horas, ella se siente a gusto realizando su labor y cree que le va bien por los buenos precios y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Rosa se encuentra muy agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá realizar la compra de mayor cantidad y variedad de vestidos de estación, de esta manera Rosa podrá atender a mas clientes, así pues ella seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de tener una gran boutique.
texts.en:
Rosa is a 24-year-old woman. She is single, and lives in the city of Camaná with her parents and siblings. She is a very kind, hardworking, and enthusiastic person, and she is very eager to improve herself. Unfortunately, due to lacking financial resources and because she had to start working when she was very young in order to help her parents, Rosa has not been able to pursue a higher education. In her free time she enjoys watching movies and occasionally she prepares delicious fried chicken to share with her family.

On her own initiative and with much hard work and dedication, Rosa runs her small business, where she sells and rents evening gowns. She works in a small shopping center and rents dresses, shoes, purses, and other items. Rosa starts work early in the morning  and works approximately ten hours every day. She enjoys her work and believes the reason business is going well is because of her good prices and because she treats others kindly.

Rosa is very grateful to Kiva lenders, because thanks to the help she receives she will be able to purchase larger quantities and a greater variety of seasonal gowns. This will allow Rosa to help more customers, so she will keep working and striving to achieve her big dream, which is to open a large boutique.

loans.use: to buy a larger amount and variety of gowns.

loans.name: Ibrahim H.

texts.en:
This is 38 year-old Ibrahim.  He is married, and has three children ages 17, 8, and 8. They all go to school. He has two additional dependents who he is fostering and live with him.  

In 2005, Ibrahim established his business selling soft and hard drinks, cigarettes, black mints, etc.  He began his business because he stopped in Class 7 due to lack of financial support; his elder sister drew him into business.  He later worked as a salesman for some years; he saved his salary and used it to establish a boutique business which he has now changed to a bar.  Working 7 days a week and 14 hours a day, he earns about Le 1,585,000 every month from this business. Inadequate capital is his major challenge. 

He would like a loan of Le 4,000,000. Ibrahim would use the loan to buy different kinds of drinks - soft, energy and hard drinks. 

In the future, Ibrahim plans to develop the bar into a guest house, educate his children, and build a house.  This house will help achieve some of his future plans.  

He thanks you for your support, and for financing his business.

loans.use: to buy different kinds of drinks - soft drinks, energy drinks and hard drinks.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy organic fertilizers

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es: Doña Matilde de 55 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y su hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa desde hace varios años su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia  tiene mucha clientela pues sus productos son de muy buena calidad, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar los gastos de su hogar, doña Matilde esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar ropa por mayor como: blusas, faldas, camisas, pantalones, etc. y seguir con su negocio para darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Matilde is 55 years old, and she lives with her husband and son in their own home. For several years now Matilde has operated a clothing sales business out of her home, and she has worked hard to grow her customer base. She offers high quality products and leverages the income from the business to cover household expenses. 

With the support from this loan, Matilde plans to purchase clothing in bulk, including: blouses, skirts, shirts, pants, etc. She hopes this investment will help her to strengthen her business and provide increased financial stability for her family.

loans.use: to purchase blouses, skirts, shirts, pants, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta vive con su hermana y su cuñado en casa de su padre, ella se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol desde hace 3 años. De esta forma es como se gana la vida. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, y es la única forma que conoce de como ganarse la vida. Es una mujer muy trabajadora, honrada y responsable. La clienta ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito para comprar los principales insumos agrícolas: abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, fertilizantes etc. Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
This borrower lives with her sister and brother-in-law in her father's home, and she has worked for the past three years farming corn and beans to make a living. She is a very hardworking, honorable and responsible woman, and the yearly farming cycle is the only way she knows how to make a living.

With the support from this loan, the borrower plans to purchase agricultural input items for tending her crops, including: manure, pesticides, seeds, fertilizers, etc. She hopes that this investment will strengthen her crops and farming operation, as it is her only source of income. She has faith that she will be able to have an abundant harvest which will allow her to continue putting food on the table for her family.

loans.use: to purchase manure, pesticides, seeds, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: Lee

texts.en:
Lee has been farming since he was born. His parents came from Laos as refugees in 1979. Lee's father had helped the Americans in the war effort. When they arrived in the U.S., they started their own small farm to make ends meet and stay productive. 

Lee followed in his parent's footsteps and started his own farm in 2012, successfully farming 10 acres of tomatoes, green beans, eggplant and other specialty Asian crops. He received a loan from Fresno CDFI to start the farm and repaid the loan in full.

Lee's farm is located on the outskirts of Fresno. He is now getting ready for the harvest season. He sells his products to local packing houses and wholesalers. Lee is requesting $5,000 to pay his harvesting crew as well as for fertilizer and other supplies for the farm. Savings from a Fresno CDFI Individual Development Account (savings match program) will supplement loan proceeds.

loans.use: to pay his harvesting crew and pay for farm inputs

loans.name: Selina

texts.en:
Selina is a twenty-year-old married woman with three children. She sells charcoal for a living. Because of her increase in clientele she is applying for a 40,000 KES loan through Yehu to buy more charcoal to keep up with her customers’ orders.

Her greatest desire is to provide an education for her children so that she can guarantee them a prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal

loans.name: Providance

texts.en: Providance is 45 years old and is married with six children. For the past ten years she has sold bed sheets and fabric. She is applying for a 800,000 RWF through Urwego to buy more bed sheets and curtains to sell. Her profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy bed sheets and curtains to sell

loans.name: Fabien

texts.en:
Fabien is 33 and single. For the past eight years he has operated a bar.

Fabien is applying for a 800,000 RWF through Urwego to buy more beer and water to sell. He plans to use the profits to renovate his house. He is very happy with the way his business is prospering.

loans.use: To buy more beer and water to sell.

loans.name: Egide

texts.en:
Egide is 40 years old. He is the father of four children between the ages of 7 and 13; all of them go to school. 

With the loan, he wants to add more mineral water, packed milk, and sodas to sell. 

The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees.

loans.use: to buy more items such as biscuits, sodas, snacks, and beverages to sell.

loans.name: Samuel Humberto

texts.es: Don Samuel de 46 años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus seis hijos, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol tiene muchos años de dedicarse a la agricultura por lo que se ha hecho de mucha experiencia en el rubro, es muy conocido en la zona y ya tiene buena clientela pues obtiene las mejores cosechas, por lo tanto comercia producto de primera calidad y a precios muy accesibles, además el servicio es inigualable, don Samuel se caracteriza por su gran amabilidad, es un hombre emprendedor con muchas ganas de salir adelante, piensa que aprovechar las oportunidades lo llevaran un paso más adelante del éxito; en la última siembra no obtuvo las ganancias esperadas y esta vez quiere aumentar la producción, pero necesita de un apoyo de capital por eso le solicita a INTEGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar semilla de maíz, frijol, fertilizante, abonos, herbicidas, etc. don Samuel tiene referencias de tener una moral intachable, responsable y de muy buena paga, confía que podrá responder a la deuda y al mismo tiempo podrá darle a su familia una vida plena.
texts.en:
Samuel is 46 years old and lives with his wife and their six children. He makes a living farming corn and beans, a trade he has mastered over many years. Samuel is well known in his area, and he has worked very hard to build his customer base. He always harvests high quality crops, and he sells his produce at affordable prices and with excellent service. Samuel is a kind, entrepreneurial man who works very hard to get ahead in life.

Since his most recent harvest did not yield the harvest he had hoped for, Samuel plans to use the support from this loan to purchase agricultural input items for tending his crops, including: seeds, fertilizers, manure, herbicides, etc. He hopes that this investment will help him to strengthen his farming operation and provide a better quality of life for his family. With an impeccable reputation and work ethic, Samuel is confident that he can make all loan repayments on time.

loans.use: to purchase seeds, fertilizers, manure, herbicides, etc. for his farming operation.

loans.name: Anatalie

texts.en:
Anatalie aged 49. She is a widow with four children; they all attend high school. 

Anatalie sells scraps of different kinds that can be used for things such as vehicles and buildings. 

With the loan, she plans to buy more scraps to sell. She plans to use the profits for paying school fees for her children.

loans.use: To buy more scraps for sale.

loans.name: Linh

texts.en:
Linh was born in 1991. He lives in Yen Phong, Bac Ninh. He studies Financial Management and Services at the Foreign Trade University (www.ftu.edu.vn/). His studies last four years, and he will graduate in 2014. He is the first person in his family to graduate high school and go on to study at the university. 

His parents have a grocery store and receive 20,000,000 VND per month. His mother is a member of SEDA’s credit program, too. 

Linh is aware that studying will give him opportunities to find a good job and gain more money. He chose this area of study because of his passion for business. He wants to borrow 14,580,000 VND to buy a computer; this loan suits his family’s situation and income.  

The loan is disbursed fast and conveniently right after completing the paper work. 

Besides lacking of funds for his educational fees, he has other difficulties like house renting fees, and transportation. 

He appreciates the lenders of this program, and he will try his best to study and work for the best future.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Sandra Milagros

texts.es:
Sandra es una jovencita de 22 años que vive con su familia.
Sandra  estudia Administración en la universidad. Ella ha elegido esta carrera porque tiene mucho futuro y le permitirá desarrollar su profesión en diversos ámbitos laborales. La profesión de Sandra dura 05 años de los cuales lleva estudiando 02, diariamente le dedica 10 horas a sus estudios; actualmente labora como practicante en el área administrativa de una empresa reconocida, el préstamo que ha solicitado le servirá para el pago de sus pensiones y comprar algunos materiales de estudio. Sandra está contenta por la oportunidad y la confianza, en un futuro cercano sueña con ser una persona productiva para poder ayudar a su familia.
texts.en:
Sandra is 22 years old and lives with her family. She is studying administration at the university level, and she chose this career path because of the wide variety of opportunities it can open up for her in the future. In her second year of in the 5-year program, Sandra dedicates 10 hours every day to her studies. In addition, she is also working as an administrative intern at a well known business in her town. 

With the support from this loan, Sandra plans to pay her university tuition as well as cover the cost of books and study materials. She is grateful for this opportunity and the support she has received, and she plans to put her studies to good use by getting a job to support her family.

loans.use: to cover tuition and study materials for her university program.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente se dedica a la agricultura desde hace varios años y eso le ha dado la capacidad y el conocimiento necesario para asistir sus cultivos, su principal siembra es el maiz y maicillo, comercializa sus cultivos en agencias de granos básicos que están cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas ayuda en los gastos que su familia tiene, vive en casa propia con su familia, el cliente esta solicitando un crédito para poder comprar insumos agrícolas que le ayuden en la siembra de sus cultivos como: abonos, semillas, fertilizantes, herbicidas, etc.  y asi poder tener mejores ganancias y seguir ayudando en los gastos de su casa sin ninguna limitacion.
texts.en: This borrower has been a farmer for a number of years, and this has given him the ability and knowledge he needs to tend to his crops.  He mainly grows corn and sorghum.  He sells his crops to the agencies who buy staple grains that are located close the place where he lives.  With the earnings he gets from his sales, he helps with the family's expenses.  He lives in his own home with his family.  He is requesting a loan to buy agricultural supplies that will help him to put in his crops, such as: manure, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, etc.  This way, he can have better earnings and continue to provide support for the household expenditures as much as possible.

loans.use: to buy manure, seeds, fertilizers, herbicides, and other supplies

loans.name: Thuy

texts.en:
Thuy was born in 1994, and she lives in Dong Anh. She is a hospitality management major at Hanoi Tourism college (http://www.htc.edu.vn); she has a passion for this study. Her course lasts three years, and she will graduate in 2015. Thuy’s family has four members, and she is the first person in her family who has studied at college. 

Her parents grow rice, and have a beverage store to earn a living. Her family’s income is about 9,000,000 VND. Her mother is Huong, who sits next to her in this picture; she is also a member of SEDA’s credit program.   

Thuy understands consistent learning gives her the knowledge and opportunities to get a high paying job. 

She wants to borrow 10,206,000 VND to pay her education fee. Besides lacking the education fee, she has other difficulties such as her living costs and transportation fees. 

She wants to tell people that she appreciates the help of people all around the world whose have contributed to this kind of program. This has been supportive to a lot of her personal education and of Vietnamese’s youth generation in general.

loans.use: to pay for her education fees.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive en casa propia con su compañera de vida y su hijo, él se dedica al cultivo de maíz y fríjol, desde hace 5 años y eso le ha dado la experiencia necesaria para asistir sus cultivos, sus cosechas las comercializa en los mercados de compra de  granos básicos, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos de su hogar. El cliente solicita un credito para poder mejorar el terreno donde piensa hacer su siembra y comprar los insumos necesarios como fertilizantes, herbicidas, abonos, semillas, entre otras cosas para tener buenas cosechas y asi el pueda obtener  mejores ganancias para poder darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
The client lives in his own house with his life partner and his child.  He has been growing corn and beans for five years.  This has given him the needed experience in order to take care of his crops.  He sells his harvests at the markets that sell basic crops.  With the earnings that he gets from his sales he manages to pay the household expenses.

The client is requesting a loan in order to be able to improve the land where he plans to plant.  He will also buy the needed supplies like fertilizers, herbicides, compost, and seeds, among other things in order to have good harvests.  This way he will be able to get better earnings in order to be able to give his family better financial stability.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, compost, and seeds, etc.

loans.name: Dúo Sara Y Alma Group

texts.es: El dúo Sara y Alma, está formado por doña María Elena, quien se dedica a la siembra y venta de flores en San Pedro Sacatepéquez y la ciudad de Guatemala, también hace algunas entregas en San Juan Sacatepéquez a las vendedoras del mercado,  Varios pedidos le han hecho pero no le alcanza la siembra que tiene, Por tal motivo necesita nuevamente hacer otro crédito para no fallarles a los clientes, está solicitando este crédito para la compra de semilla y abono para el cultivo de flores.
texts.en: Maria Elena is a member of the communal bank "Sara y Alma."  She has a business growing and selling flowers in San Pedro Sacatepéquez and in the City of Guatemala.  She also makes some deliveries to the sellers in the market in San Juan Sacatepéquez.  She has a lot of orders, but she can't fill them with the flowers she has.  For this reason, she needs another loan so she won't let down her customers.  She is requesting this loan to buy seeds and organic fertilizer to cultivate flowers.

loans.use: to buy seeds and organic fertilizer to cultivate flowers

loans.name: Orjah Group

texts.en:
Meet the members of the “Orjah” group from Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. They are all local entrepreneurs who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva.org, to apply for a loan of SLL 400,000 for each member. With the help of this loan, they will be able to expand their respective businesses, increase their sales and consequently improve their living conditions. 

Elizabeth is the featured leader of this group. The 26-year-old is married to a diamond miner and the couple has three children of whom two are attending primary schools. Elizabeth has been a businesswoman for five years now. She sells market food – palm oil, onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), peppers, etc. With her share of this loan, Elizabeth will buy the above-mentioned items in wholesale to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), peppers, etc.

loans.name: Jacqueline Jeaneth

texts.es: Jaqueline de 33 años de edad vive con su esposo y su hijo, ella tiene un negocio de salon de belleza desde hace 2 años en su lugar de residencia trabaja de 9:00 am a 7:00 pm tiene mucha clientela pues trabaja muy bien, con las ganancias que obtiene y con la ayuda de su esposo logran solventar los gastos de su hogar. jaqueline solicita un credito para poder comprar productos para su salon de belleza como: cremas, shampoo, ganchos para el cabello, tijeras, entre otras cosas que necesita y asi podra obtener mejores ganancias que le ayudaran a tener una mejor estabilidad economica.
texts.en:
Jaqueline, 33, lives with her husband and child.  She's had a beauty salon business for 2 years.  Her business is located in her house, and she works there from 9am until 7pm.  She has a lot of customers because she does very good work.  With the earnings she gets, and with the help of her husband, the couple is able to cover the household expenses.  

Jaqueline is requesting a loan to buy products for her beauty salon such as: creams, shampoo, hair clips, scissors, and other items that she needs.  This way she will be able to generate more earnings, which will help her to have more economic stability.

loans.use: to buy creams, shampoo, hair clips, scissors, and other items

loans.name: Rudy Ernesto

texts.es: Rudy de 32 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol. De esta forma es como se gana la vida y puede llevar el pan de cada día a su hogar. La actividad del cultivo la realiza año con año, y es la única forma que conoce de como ganarse la vida. Es un hombre muy trabajador, honrado y responsable. A pesar de las condiciones en las que vive, las cuales son muy humildes no se cansa de trabajar y de dar lo mejor a su familia. Es un hombre luchador. Siempre está al pendiente de su familia ya que para él es su principal fuente de inspiración y desea poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida. Ha tomado la decisión de acercarse a esta institución para solicitar este crédito y comprar los principales insumos agrícolas como abonos, venenos para plagas, semillas, fertilizantes, etc. Espera tener resultados favorables ya que no cuenta con otra fuente de ingresos. Confía en Dios que logrará obtener una cosecha abundante la cual le permitirá seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar.
texts.en:
Rudy is 32 years old and makes a living farming corn and beans. He is a very hardworking, honorable and responsible man, and his farming operation is his only source of income and livelihood. Even though he lives in very challenging conditions, Rudy never tires of working and always does everything he can to provide for his family. His family means a great deal to him, and they are his inspiration to continue working hard every day.

With the support from this loan, Rudy plans to purchase agricultural input items for tending his crops, including: manure, pesticides, seeds, fertilizer, etc. He hopes that this investment will help him to put food on the table by strengthening his farming operation and yielding a plentiful harvest, since his crops are his only source of income.

loans.use: to purchase manure, pesticides, seeds, fertilizers, etc.

loans.name: One Way Group

texts.en:
Kumba is the featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs. Kumba was born in the city of Koidu 37 years ago. She is married to a motor-mechanic. Kumba sells market food – palm oil, onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, fish, etc. She has been doing this business for three years now. 

With the help of this loan, Kumba and her group members will be able to expand their respective businesses, increase their sales and consequently improve their living conditions. Kumba will use her share of the loan (SLL 500,000) to buy palm oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, fish, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, fish, etc. in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Business Group

texts.en:
In the photo are members of the “Business” group. They are small-scale businesswomen based in Koidu, a city in Eastern Sierra Leone. Together, they are requesting a loan of SLL 2,500,000 in order to expand their respective businesses. 

The featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Isatu, a 36-year-old. She was born in Sefadu, near the city of Koidu. Currently, she lives in Koidu with her husband, who is a driver. The couple's two children attend primary and secondary schools respectively. 

For nine years now,  Isatu has been selling palm oil (the country’s No. 1 cooking oil), onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, tomatoes, etc. With this loan, Isatu will buy palm oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, tomatoes, etc. at wholesale prices to add to her business stock.

loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, tomatoes, etc. to add to her business stock.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet lives in the Nkubu area of Kenya, which grows a lot of 'miraa', which can be chewed like tobacco. She has three children and has been doing farm work for twelve years.  Her primary income sources are milk, tea, and crops.

She stated what is most enjoyable about farming: 'Managing herself and being able to make a living.' Her biggest challenges are pests and diseases.  Animals on the farm have been given the names of 'Jomo.'

Janet was asked why she chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which she replied: 'Convenience in disbursement and a flexible payment period.'  This client was also asked what she learned during Juhudi's required micro-finance training session: 'That I can achieve my target if I take the loan with the right mindset.'

Her highest monthly expense is school fees. When asked how this loan would benefit her family, Janet replied, 'their living standards will improve.'

As part of Juhudi's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Janet owns 'cows and poultry' but does not own 'pigs, pump, bicycle, motorcycle, or automobile'. Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household 'a mosquito net, solar power, running water, TV, and DVD' but does not have 'electricity or a sewing machine'.

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To construct a zero grazing unit

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan lives in the Eldoret area of Kenya, which is a primary milk producing area. He has 1 child and has been doing this work for 5 years.  His primary income sources are milk, eggs, and crops in his personal business.

He stated what is most enjoyable about farming: "feeding my animals." His biggest challenge is "getting dairy feed." Animals on the farm have been given the names of "friti."

Jonathan was asked why he chose Juhudi Kilimo for this loan, to which he replied, "training programmes."  This client was also asked what was learned during Juhudi Kilimo's required micro-finance training session, and answered, "group guarantee."

His highest monthly expense is farming costs. When asked how this loan will benefit his family, Jonathan replied, "I can buy more animals."

As part of Juhudi Kilimo's loan appraisal process, each borrower's assets are evaluated. Jonathan owns the following: "cow, poultry, bicycle" but does not own "pig, pump, motorcycle, automobile." Juhudi Kilimo also tries to measure any change in living standards based on this loan. This borrower has in the household "mosquito net, solar power, TV" but does not have "electricity, running water, sewing machine, DVD."

Note: To create this loan profile, Juhudi Kilimo used a mobile device to gather information in the field and send the data to a central online repository, thus reducing paper use, making the process more efficient, and keeping costs down.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Peaceful Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are members of the “Peaceful” group from Koidu, a city in eastern Sierra Leone. They are petty-businesswomen who have come to SMT, a partner of Kiva, in order to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000 for each in the group. With this loan, they will be able to add more goods to their respective businesses, attract more customers, make more sales and profit, and consequently improve on their living conditions. 

The featured leader of this group of entrepreneurs is Adama. Adama was born in Kombayinde, in eastern Sierra Leone. She is married to a farmer and has three children, two of whom are attending primary and secondary schools. 

Adama has been a businesswoman for four years now. She sells market-food items like tomatoes, etc. With her share of this loan, she is going to buy a large quantity of tomatoes, etc. to add to her current stock.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of tomatoes, etc. to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Konomotomononah Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Konomotomononah” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000.00 for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Finda is the featured leader of this group. Finda is 49-year-old, she is married with 3 children – 2 in secondary school and 1 in college. Finda sells market-food – palm-oil (the country most popular cooking oil), onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, fish, etc. She has been doing business for 9 years now. With the help of this loan, Finda will invest in her business by buying palm-oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, fish, etc. in larger quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, fish, etc. in larger quantities to add to her business

loans.name: Blessing Iii Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Blessing III” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000.00 for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Safea is the featured leader of this group. Safea is 49-year-old, he is married with 2 children – 1 in primary school and 1 in secondary school. Safea sells cloths and building materials. He has been a businessman for 12 years now.  He has requested this loan in order to expand his business inventory. He will use this loan to buy more cloths and building materials to add to his current stock.

loans.use: to buy more cloths and building materials to add to his current stock

loans.name: Devine Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, Northern Sierra Leone is very pleased to present to you members of the “Devine” group. These are small scale entrepreneurs who have come to SMT/Kiva lenders to apply for a loan of SLL 500,000.00 for each in order to invest in their respective businesses. 

Yei is the featured leader of this group. Yei is 41-year-old, she is married with 3 children – 1 in primary school and 2 in secondary school. Yei sells market-food palm-oil(the country most popular cooking oil), onions, margi (used to give sauce a sweet taste), salt, pepper, fish, etc. She has been doing this business for 6 years now. With the help of this loan, Yei will invest in her business by buying palm-oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, fish, etc. in larger quantities to add to her business.

loans.use: to buy palm-oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, fish, etc. in larger quantities to add to her business

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
This is 35-year-old Memunatu.  She is married and has four children, aged 18, 12, 9 and 4 years. 

In 2011, Memunatu established her drinks business. She began her business because she wants to help her husband in solving some domestic home problems. Her business is located in the outskirts, and her main customers are general community people. Working 7 days a week and 13 hours a day, she earns about Le 1,000,000 every month from this business. 

Memunatu would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. She requires a loan in order to buy more drinks for resale. 

In the future, Memunatu plans to become an international businesswoman and to educate her children. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drinks for resale.

loans.name: Ángela Del Carmen

texts.es: La señora Angela del Carmen habita en el municipio de La Concepcion en la comarca San Juan, su mayor sueño es mejorar su condiciones de Vida,  junto a su esposo e hijos luchan dia a dia para lograr sus objetivos, actualmente tiene cultivada una manzana de Pitahaya las cuales requieren de Mantenimiento para su produccion sea de calidad y sus ingresos aumenten, con este nuevo credito comprara insumos y Fertilizantes como: Urea, Triple, Completo, Fungisidas etc. Agredece el apoyo que incondicionalmente Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en: Angela del Carmen lives in the town of La Concepción in the San Juan district.  Her greatest dream is to improve her living conditions.  Together with her husband and children, she strives day by say to achieve her goals.  Currently, she is cultivating a “manzana” [a unit of measurement equal to about 1.7 acres] of "pitahaya“[a fruit-bearing cactus] that requires maintenance in order for her production to be of quality and her income to grow.  She will use this new loan to purchase supplies and fertilizers such as Urea, Triple, Completo, fungicides and others.  She is grateful for the unconditional support provided by Afodenic and Kiva funding.

loans.use: to purchase farming supplies.

loans.name: Reselia

texts.pt:
A Senhora Resélia é solteira, possui 5 filhos e desses só vive com 2, que a ajudam nos negócios e os restantes 3 estudam a mais de 30 km de casa num centro internato. A base do seu sustento é o seu negócio de venda de loiças e cobertores na sua própria casa. Ela vai usar o empréstimo para comprar bacias e mantas para revender. 
As suas maiores esperanças e sonhos são a construção de uma loja para vender seus produtos e uma casa de blocos, pois neste momento vive numa casa de chapas de zinco.
Seu maior desafio é trabalhar mais e diversificar o seu negócio.
texts.en:
Resélia is single and has five children. She only lives with two of her children, who help her in her business. The other three attend a boarding school over 30 kilometers away from home.
Her means of livelihood is her business of selling crockery and blankets from home. She will use the loan to purchase bowls and quilts for re-selling.
Her biggest hopes and dreams are building a store in order to sell her merchandise and also building a brick house, since at the moment she lives in a house made of metal sheets.
Her main challenge is working harder and diversifying her business.

loans.use: to purchase bowls and quilts for re-selling.

loans.name: Mamie

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Mamie. She is married and has two children, aged 23 and 20 years. She has one additional dependent who lives with her because of schooling.

In 1991, Mamie established her palm oil and motorbike services business. She began her business because she did not go to school. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, she earns about Le 1,500,000 every month from this business.

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Mamie has already received and successfully repaid her first loan and now requires a new loan in order to purchase drums of palm oil. 

In the future, Mamie plans to build more houses. The plan to build more houses was not accomplished, but she succeeded in buying more drums of palm oil, and she also paid her children’s school fees. She is still planning to build houses and also stores for commercial use.  She is thanking you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more drums of palm oil.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en:
Farming is a way of life and a family tradition for Gerardo. His father farmed South Texas land. Gerardo ventured off to try other work, but came back to the family business. While Gerardo’s father worked for other farmers, Gerardo wanted to be his own boss. 

“I had a little money saved up and I started buying equipment little by little,” Gerardo said. “Every year, I would get equipment and make payments on my equipment. It’s been a struggle in the past few years, though.” 

To sustain his family and himself, Gerardo works full-time in an office, but he farms when he’s not working in the office. Gerardo currently has a crop of alfalfa. In the past, he grew livestock grass. And before the drought, one of his most profitable crops was chili peppers.  

At the start of the recession, Gerardo did well investing in a versatile and powerful John Deere tractor that could plow, chisel and level land. Small farmers passing by his 52-acre plot saw him leveling land with ease and asked him to do the same with their land. There were so many requests that leveling land became a significant source of income for his company, A. Custom Work. 

But when Texas got hit with the worst single year drought in history in 2011, Gerardo said as land in South Texas cracked and parched up, his business dried up too. And when the drought continued in 2012 and was sustained through 2013, Gerardo said he faced losing his tractor.
 
While attending a workshop with the Texas A&M AgriLife Extension in El Paso, Gerardo met a loan officer from Accion Texas Inc., who advised him on how to refinance the loan into smaller more affordable payments. Using his John Deere swather as collateral, Gerardo obtained a $5,625 loan from Accion to pay off his tractor.

“I probably would have lost my tractor if I hadn’t gotten this loan from Accion Texas,” Gerardo said. 

Gerardo is toughing out the drought because farming is a way of life and a family tradition. When the drought clears up, he hopes to start growing chili again.

“My plan is to learn ways to improve myself,” Gerardo said. “We are all hoping the water situation improves, too.”

loans.use: to pay off his tractor.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cement, sand and rock dust in order to manufacture bricks for selling.

loans.name: Señor De Los Milagros Group
