texts.es: La Alcancía Comunal “Señor De Los Milagros” está constituida por 07 mujeres emprendedoras  y dinámicas, siendo la gran  mayoría de ellas  vecinas de la zona. Este es el caso de Hilda de 47 años casada y con 02 hijos independientes. Hilda comenzó realizando tejidos, poco a poco fue mejorando sus ingresos. Es así como decide iniciar su propio negocio, donde actualmente ofrece productos de primera necesidad. Gracias a su esfuerzo y dedicación Hilda a podido apoyar a sus hijos en su educación y mejorar su vivienda. Su mayor deseo es de ver a sus hijos realizados profesionalmente y seguir implementando su negocio. Con los deseos de seguir mejorando solicitó el crédito la cual comprará víveres como arroz, azúcar, leche, fideos y bebidas. El grupo “Señor De Los Milagros” agradecen el crédito brindado. Hilda está ubicada en la parte posterior, es la segunda del lado izquierdo, viste chaleco rojo y polo a rayas.
texts.en: The Community Alliance "Señor De Los Milagros” (Our Lord of Miracles) consists of 7 dynamic and enterprising women, the majority of whom are neighbors. Hilda is 47 years old, married, with 2 grown children. Hilda began making weavings, little by little growing her income. So she decided to start her own business, where today she sells basic need goods.  Thanks to her efforts and dedication Hilda has been able to support her children in their education and improve their quality of life. Her greatest wish is to see her children become professionals and to continue growing her business. With the wishes to improve her business she sought a loan in order to buy basic items such as rice, sugar, milk, noodles, and beverages. The "Señor De Los Milagros” group is thankful for the provided loan. Hilda is located in the back section of the photo, second from the left, dressed in a red vest and striped shirt.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, milk, noodles and beverages.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional live bait, fishing poles, and snacks for her customers.

loans.name: Adam

texts.en:
A loan of $6,950 will help Adam upgrade his equipment. He plans on purchasing a new hard drive for an iMac and a 16-35 mm “L” lens as well as a fish eye lens. 

Adam is a second generation American, third generation business owner, and father of two young sons. Following his graduation from NYU’s Tisch School of the Arts in Film Production, he started Sharpshooter Pictures, a NY-based award winning Production Company that creates premium video and still photography for Fortune 500 companies. His clients include About.com, ABC Television, Groupon, Seamless, Jennifer Hudson, Forbes, The Hartford, Yahoo, among others. 

In the aftermath of hurricane Sandy, Adam felt compelled to help and he did so by making two pro bono videos for Friends of Firefighters. This was used as a fundraising tool to help residents of Breezy Point. 

To check out his work and and learn more about Adam’s production company, please visit www.sharpshooterpictures.com.

loans.use: to upgrade equipment

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.en:
A loan of $8,550 helps Eduardo to increase inventory to offer a wider range of merchandise to his customers. 

Born and raised in Buenos Aires, Argentina, Eduardo began learning about the jewelry industry in his teenage years. First, he worked as an apprentice and then moved to work in a production line for a local manufacturer. When he moved to the U.S. 25 years ago, he continued to pursue his passion for jewelry design and reports by working for several jewelry factories. While he originally operated a jewelry business in a storefront, in 2012 he decided to register as a sole proprietor to begin his business in an existing space, World of Watches, a jewelry store located in a busy shopping plaza in Las Vegas. Eduardo’s main focus is on selling and repairing jewelry. The success of his business is due to his ability to provide outstanding customer service by finding and designing jewelry pieces unique to clients' requests. 

Eduardo’s vision for the future is multifaceted: personally, he wants to create a better life for his family and to leave a successful business for his two children to take over. From a business standpoint, he aspires to become a known, respected, and honest jeweler, not only among peers, but also within his community.

loans.use: to increase inventory

loans.name: Luis

texts.en:
A loan of $9,150 helps Luis to purchase printing equipment and cover installation, delivery, and maintenance costs. With his new offset printing press, he can widen the range of services he offers to customers. 

After nearly 28 years of working in the printing business, including in his native Dominican Republic, Luis decided it was time to follow his passion by independently operating his own business. As the owner of Lewis Graphic Services, he designs and prints books, brochures, letterheads, etc. Luis prides himself on excellent customer service and satisfaction. 

Luis has received one previous loan from Accion East and Online, which he has made steady payments on and is now refinancing.

loans.use: to purchase additional printing equipment to increase range of services

loans.name: Andres

texts.en:
A loan of $3,225 helps Andres to purchase additional massage tables and to make minor renovations to his new business space. He is hiring an additional staff member and relocating to a larger space to help accommodate an increased demand for services after a successful campaign with Google Deals and Living Social. 

His business, JP’s Massage Therapy, previously operated out of a one-room shared space with no parking. He has selected a space that was previously a massage studio and is well-suited to his needs in that it will not be shared and has enough room and increased visibility. 

While Andres envisions a future in which he would be able to work 100% of the time at his own business, he currently works for a school during the work week. He devotes his evenings and weekends to JP’s Massage Therapy Center. Andres adds to his vision by stating he hopes his business, one day, will have multiple employees and multiple locations throughout the Boston area. 

More details on his massage therapy center can be found at www.jpsmassage.com.

loans.use: to purchase massage equipment and renovate his new business space

loans.name: Billie

texts.en:
Forevergreen Counseling Ministries is an educational ministry that preaches the word of God on Sundays and completes ministry work Monday through Saturday. 

Owned by Billie, a devoted 54-year-old woman, the ministry offers a range of services. As Billie tells it, the ministry is a vessel to educate children, offer marriage counseling, and help others daily. 

Along with her team, Billie tries to attend as many conventions to help improve her ministry when possible and conducts most of her service work outside the ministry. To enhance the amount of people Billie reaches through the ministry, she reached to Accion Texas Inc. for a loan; $4,375 paid for a car for one of her team members, which will also allow for transporting students to and from school. “They’re helping us to help other people,” she says.

Billie says the amount of work she is doing now, is only half of what is in store for Forevergreen. She began a youth program YOU, Youth Org United, which she plans to continue, and writes and sings songs and is ready to produce a CD to promote God through the power of music. 

She said to the Accion staff, “Thanks for helping me.”

loans.use: to buy a car for one of her team members, which will also allow for transporting students to and from school.

loans.name: Sonia

texts.pt:
A Senhora Sónia é solteira e tem 2 filhos, 1 dele menor e outro frequentando o ensino Secundário a 10Km da sua casa.
Ela é modista e estilista. Tem um atelier em Boane, onde faz costura de roupas e vende. Ela vai usar o empréstimo para comprar tecidos para fabrico de roupas.
Para além disto, a Senhora Sónia ensina adolescentes e adultos a costurar, organizando formações de 45 dias no seu atelier, o que lhe permite ter um rendimento extra.
Seu maior sonho é ter um reconhecimento internacional no mundo da moda e poder expor as suas obras com estilistas de todo mundo. No entanto, depara-se com algumas dificuldades em encontrar mercado e falta de recursos para promover o seu trabalho.
texts.en:
Sónia is single and has two children. One of her children is underage and the other one attends high school 10 kilometers away from home.
She's a dressmaker and a designer. She owns a shop in Boane where she sews and sells clothing. She'll use the loan to purchase fabric in order to make clothing.
Aside from that, Sónia teaches teenagers and adults to sew by organizing 45-day courses in her shop. This allows her to earn extra income.
Her biggest dream is to be internationally recognized in the fashion world and to be able to showcase her creations alongside designers from all over the world. However, she faces some difficulties such as finding a market and lacking resources for promoting her work.

loans.use: to purchase fabric in order to make clothing in her shop.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
This is 51-year-old Fatmata. She is married and has four children, aged 32, 30, 28 and 22 years. 

In 2006, Fatmata established her baby clothing business. She began her business because she wants to help her husband in some responsibilities. Her business is located in the outskirts, and her main customers are women. Working 7 days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 700,000 every month from this business. 

Fatmata would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. She requires a loan in order to buy more Pampers, baby oil, powder, etc. for resale. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to develop and to build a shop on her own and also educate her children to university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more Pampers, baby oil, powder, etc. for resale.

loans.name: Emmanuel Group

texts.es: Este grupo está formado con cinco socias emprendedoras de éxito, una de ellas es Linda mujer de 21 años, casada con un hijo de dos años, su negocio es tener una pulpería en su domicilio, desde hace 18 meses, anteriormente era estudiante lo que se casa y abre su negocio  para aportar al gasto de su familia, el crédito lo invertirá en la compra de granos como arroz, frijol, azúcar, aceite, crema acida, leches en bolsa, mantequilla, pan, pan dulce, carne de res, carne de pollo  etc. Marling tiene 30 años de edad su negocio es la venta de comida en su domicilio, Elena tiene 55 años de edad su negocio es la venta de tortilla, María Mercedes tiene 23 años su negocio es la venta de ropa nueva, y Francisca tiene 50 años de edad su negocio es la venta de perfumen y venta de ropa nueva.
texts.en: This group consists of five successful, enterprising members, one of whom is Linda. She is 21 years old, married with a two year old son, and her business is a small grocery store in her home that she has had for 18 months. Previously she was a student and she opened her business to support her family's expenses. The loan will be used to buy grains like rice, beans, sugar, oil, sour cream, bagged milk, butter, bread, sweet bread, beef, chicken, etc. Marling is 30 years old, her business is selling food from her home. Elenta is 55 years old, her business is selling tortillas. María Mercedes is 23 years old, her business is selling new clothing. Francisca is 50 years old, her business is selling perfume and new clothing.

loans.use: to buy grains like rice, beans, sugar, oil, sour cream, bagged milk, butter, bread, sweet bread, beef, chicken, etc.

loans.name: Henriqueta

texts.pt:
A Senhora Henriqueta vive em Boane. É solteira e tem 2 filhos ambos frequentando o ensino secundário longe de casa.
A sua base de sustento é o negócio. Ela é negociante de roupas usadas, que adquire a 30Km da sua casa e revende no mercado local. Além disto, em sua casa cria galinhas poedeiras e vende ovos.
A Senhora Henriqueta irá aplicar o empréstimo na compra de fardos de roupas usadas (calças e bolsas) para revender.
Ela gostaria de terminar a sua casa e aumentar o tamanho da sua capoeira de modo a aumentar o número de galinhas poedeiras.
Sua maior dificuldade é conseguir espaço para exercer as suas actividades.
texts.en:
Henriqueta lives in Boane. She's single and has two children, both of whom attend high school away from home.
Her means of livelihood is her business. She trades used clothing, which she buys 30 kilometers away from her home and then re-sells at the local market. Besides, she raises laying hens in her house and sells eggs.
Henriqueta will use the loan to purchase bundles of used clothing (trousers and bags) for re-selling.
She would like to finish her house and enlarge her coop in order to increase the number of laying hens.
Her biggest difficulty is getting enough space for carrying out her business activities.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of used clothing (trousers and bags) for re-selling.

loans.name: Sumah

texts.en: This is 33-year-old Sumah. He is married and has no children. In 2009, Sumah established his business selling drinks of various brands. He began his business because he wanted to generate more income from development. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about Le 1,500,000 every month as profit from this business. He would like a loan of Le 5,000,000. Sumah requires this loan as working capital. In the future, Sumah plans to be an importer of different types of drinks to be sold to retailers. Sumah’s dream were not met but through the additional income he was able to open another shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy more drinks for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items such as hair weaves and earrings for resale

loans.name: Maryin Elieth

texts.es: Maryin, es una joven de 27 años de edad, habita en el barrio 30 de Mayo, tiene una hija de 8 años que estudia en el colegio del barrio, ella es madre soltera; en la vida le ha tocado trabajar arduamente ya que solamente logro cursar el tercer grado de primaria, hoy en día se dedica a la venta de cabeza de cerdo, también hace sopa, repochetas, vigoron y refrescos; platillos típicos del país, para continuar haciendo las ventas del día solicita el crédito para bastecerse de materia prima.
texts.en: Maryin is 27 years old and lives in the 30 de Mayo neighborhood. She has an 8 year old daughter in the neighborhood school. Maryin is a single mother. She has had to work hard in her life as she only finished 3rd grade in elementary school. Today she dedicates herself to selling pork, she also makes soup, repochetas (similar to tacos), vigarones (cabbage salad, boiled yuca, and chicharrones wrapped in plantain leaves) and beverages, which are typical dishes of her country. In order to continue selling daily she is seeking a loan to stock up on ingredients.

loans.use: to buy pork, vegetables and fruit

loans.name: Fernando

texts.pt:
O Senhor Fernando é residente em Boane, vive maritalmente há mais de 5 anos e tem 3 filhos menores, sendo que o mais velho tem 8 anos e possui uma deficiência física. Cuida também da sua irmã mais nova, também possuidora de deficiência. Ele trabalha como professor primário a 40Km da sua casa.
Pretende usar o empréstimo para comprar uma porta, 2 janelas, 20 sacos de cimento, pagar o transporte destes materiais e a mão-de-obra, para dar continuidade à construção da sua casa.
Seu maior sonho é de construir uma barraca para a sua esposa, que neste momento se encontra desempregada, poder abrir um negócio. Ele sonha também em dar continuidade aos seus estudos superiores, que interrompeu por não conseguir compatibilizar com o seu horário de trabalho.
Seu maior desafio e conseguir juntar dinheiro para financiar os seus estudos.
texts.en:
Fernando lives in Boane. He has been in a common law marriage for over five years and has three underage children. The eldest of his children is 8 years old and handicapped. He also takes care of his younger sister, who's also handicapped. He works as an elementary school teacher 40 kilometers away from his home.
He intends to use the loan to purchase a door, two windows and 20 sacks of cement, and to pay for labor and for transportation of these supplies in order to continue building his house.
His biggest dream is to build a booth so that his wife who's currently unemployed can start a business. He also dreams of moving forward with his college studies, which he interrupted because he couldn't reconcile them with his work schedule.
His biggest challenge is being able to save money to pay for his studies.

loans.use: to purchase a door, two windows and 20 sacks of cement, and to pay for labor and for transportation of these supplies in order to continue building his house.

loans.name: Joel Estanislao

texts.es:
Joel es un hombre de 51 años, vive en la ciudad de Chincha con sus tres hijos, a quienes ama y son su principal razón en la vida, el es una persona muy amable, trabajador y entusiasta, que dedica todos sus esfuerzos por sacar adelante a su familia, ya que el siempre ha sido padre y madre para sus hijos; lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos y por la necesidad que tuvo de trabajar desde muy joven Joel no pudo estudiar la carrera profesional de Electricidad que deseaba, en sus ratos libres le gusta jugar con sus hijos y en algunas ocasiones cocina un riquísimo Ceviche para compartir con su familia.
Por iniciativa propia, con mucho empeño y dedicación, Joel trabaja como buzo artesanal en embarcaciones pesqueras de su ciudad, el trabaja todos los días por un aproximado de 10 horas y cree que le va bien por su experiencia y por el trato amable que brinda a los demás.
Joel se encuentra muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva, ya que gracias a la ayuda brindada podrá cubrir los gastos de estudios de su hijo mejor, ya que desea comprarle libros, cuadernos y otros útiles escolares que necesita, ya que él se encuentra cursando su formación primaria, así pues Joel seguirá trabajando y esforzándose para lograr su gran sueño de darle una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Joel is a 51 year old man.  He lives in the city of Chincha with his three children.  He loves his children and they are his main reason for living.  He is a very friendly, hardworking, and enthusiastic person. Joel dedicates all of his efforts to get his family ahead because he has always been both father and mother to his children.  Regrettably, due to lack of finances and the need to start working at a very young age, Joel couldn’t study for the degree in electricity that he wanted.  In his free time, he enjoys playing with his children and sometimes cooks a delicious “Ceviche” [marinated raw fish or shellfish] to share with his family.

By his own initiative, and with much determination and dedication, Joel works as an artisanal diver on fishing vessels in the city.  He works every day for about ten hours and believes that it is going well because of his experience and the kind way he treats others.

Joel is very grateful for the Kiva loans.  Thanks to their support, he will be able to pay for his oldest son’s educational expenses.  He wants to buy him books, notebooks, and other school supplies that he needs since he is completing his primary education.  Joel will continue working and striving to achieve his greatest dream of providing his children with a good education.

loans.use: to pay for his oldest son's educational expenses.

loans.name: Jose Eduardo

texts.es: Don jose de 45 años de edad es un hombre muy responsable con sus obligaciones de hogar, ya que siempre se ha caracterizado por brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Actualmente vive junto a su esposa y sus hijos,  es muy trabajador, siempre lo ha realizado con alegría y entusiasmo, se dedica a ser agricultora siembra todos los años los principales granos básicos de la zona como lo son, maíz y frijol. José desea incrementar sus ventas y por eso visitó las oficinas de INTEGRAL para solicitar un crédito el cual le permita comprar: semillas, abonos, fertilizantes, pesticidas entre otros. Desea contar con la ayuda solicitada puesto que no tiene otros ingresos y asi podrá darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en:
Jose, 45, is a man who is very responsible with his household responsibilities.  He has always been known for providing the best for his family.  He lives with his wife and children.  He is very hardworking, and always works with cheer and enthusiasm.  He is a farmer, and every year he cultivates the staple grains of the region, such as corn and beans.  

Jose wants to increase his sales, and so this is why he visited the offices of INTEGRAL to request a loan.  This loan will allow him to buy seeds, organic and chemical fertilizers, pesticides, and other supplies.  He wants to rely on this financial assistance because he has no other income, and this will enable him to provide his family with better economic stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds, organic and chemical fertilizers, pesticides, and other supplies

loans.name: Maria Alejandra

texts.es: Doña maria de 50 años de edad desde hace 10 años que se dedica a la agricultura la cual es su principal fuente de ingresos, siembra maiz y frijol cuando su cosecha ya esta lista la almacena en los sacos que muestra la fotografía, con lo que gana de sus cosechas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar. Ella quiere comprar los insumos necesarios para sus cosechas como abonos, fertilizantes, semillas, etc. pero dado que no cuenta con los recursos económicos necesarios para dicha inversión ha tomado la decisión de solicitar un crédito ya que solo de esta forma puede continuar su proceso de cultivo. Al igual que todo campesino, deposita su confianza en la agricultura ya que no poseen otra fuente de ingresos y desea superarse haciendo lo mejor que puede en sus cultivos. Espera obtener una cosecha abundante que le permita seguir llevando el pan de cada día a su hogar y cancelar dicho crédito.
texts.en:
Doña María, 50 years old, has been farming for ten years and this is her principal source of income. She cultivates corn and beans and when her crops are ready she stores them in large sacks as shown in the photograph. With her earnings from the harvest, she is able to pay some of her household expenses. 

She wants to buy the supplies necessary for her crops, such as compost, fertilizer, seeds, etc., however since she lacks the financial resources for such an investment she has decided to apply for a loan; this is the only way she can continue to farm. Like all farmers she puts her faith in farming because she has no other source of income. Moreover she wants to excel by doing the best she can for her crops. She hopes to have an abundant harvest that will enable her to continue putting bread on the table every day, while repaying her loan.

loans.use: to purchase compost, fertilizer, seeds, etc.

loans.name: Yafane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Yafane âgé de 45 ans, s’active dans l’élevage depuis plus de 10 ans. Il fait de l’embouche bovine et reste actif durant toute la journée. Il vient solliciter un crédit de 500000F CFA  pour  l’achat de cinq bœufs qu’il va emboucher pour revendre dans les marchés locaux. 
Yafane est marié et père de famille. Il s’occupe des charges familiales et veille à ce que les membres de sa famille soient dans de bonnes conditions de vie.
Yafane nourrit un projet qui lui tient à cœur : c’est-à-dire celui d’avoir une ferme où il pourra élever aussi bien des bœufs, des moutons, des chèvres que des poulets.
texts.en:
Yafane is 45 years old and he has been actively involved in raising livestock for more than 10 years.  He fattens cows and he is very active throughout the day.  He is requesting a loan of 500,000 CFA francs to buy five oxen which he will fatten and then resell at local markets.

Yafane is married and he has a family.  He takes care of his family's expenses and makes sure that his family members enjoy good living conditions.

Yafane would very much like to see his future project become a reality: he would like to have a farm where he could raise oxen, sheep, goats and chickens.

loans.use: to buy five oxen to raise and resell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El cliente vive con su compañera de vida y su hijo, en casa propia, el se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol, tiene varios años de trabajar en la agricultura y eso le  ha regalado mucha experiencia que le permite obtener las mejores cultivos, sus cosechas las comercia en los alrededores de la comunidad, ya tiene mucha clientela que lo prefieren por la calidad, los buenos precios y sobre todo por el buen servicio; el cliente necesita invertir en sus siembras por eso  solicita un crédito que le permita comprar semillas de maíz, frijol, insecticida, herbicida, etc. el cliente  tiene buenas referencias de pago por parte de sus conocidos, y es muy responsable, asegura que podrá cancelar la deuda en el periodo establecido y a la vez confía que llevara a su hogar seguridad económica.
texts.en:
This client lives with his life’s companion and their son in their own house. He cultivates corn and beans and has spent several years working as a farmer. That has given him a great deal of experience and enables him to have the best crops. He sells his harvests in surrounding areas and has many customers who prefer him because of the quality and good prices of his crops and above all because of his good service. 

The client needs to invest in his fields and is applying for a loan that will permit him to purchase corn and bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide, etc. He has good references for loan re-payment from his acquaintances and he is very responsible. He claims that he will be able to pay off the debt within the established time frame and he is also confident that the funding will provide his household with economic security.

loans.use: to purchase corn and bean seeds, insecticide, herbicide, etc.

loans.name: Djiguisseme Group

texts.fr:
Les sept  femmes du groupe Djiguisseme sont mariées majoritairement dans des familles Polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 39 ans et 3 enfants. Elles habitent toutes dans le village de Nerekoro dans la région de Ségou (4ème Région administrative du Mali) et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage, de parenté et de mariage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de condiments, d’échalotes, de la patate, du melon etc. 
Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Aminata  (2ème femme debout de la  droite vers la gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des condiments de toutes sortes. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 sacs d’échalote et de la patate. La revente se fait au comptant  et à crédit à domicile à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Aminata espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 25000 FCFA avec ce prêt, qui sera réinvesti dans l’activité et assurer le ravitaillement du foyer en condiments.
texts.en:
The seven women who make up the Djiguisseme group are mostly married in polygamous families.  On average, they are 39 years old and have three children each. They all live in the village of Nerekoro, near Segou (fourth administrative region of Mali) and they know one another through neighborhood, marriage and family ties. They are involved in small retail business, selling condiments, shallots, potatoes, melons etc.

They have decided to join Soro Yiriwaso in order to increase their businesses, and they are on their third solidarity loan cycle.

Aminata, standing second from the right in the photo, is well-known as an important seller of various condiments. She plans to use her loan to buy five bags of shallots and some potatoes. She resells her goods from home, for cash or on credit, to a customer base which mostly consists of women.

With this loan, Aminata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 25,000 CFA francs which will be reinvested in her business and also used to buy condiments for her household.

loans.use: to buy shallots and potatoes.

loans.name: Apolinaria

texts.es:
Apolinaria tiene  48 años, esta casada y vive en una casa construida a base de adobe junto a sus 4 hijos. 
Apolinaria se dedica a la agricultura junto a su esposo desde hace 20 años y su trabajo es mantener en buen estado las plantaciones de cacao y otras plantas que poseen ya que son el principal sustento económico.
Se inició con ayuda de sus padres quienes le cedieron un terreno agrícola para ganar dinero y solucionar los gastos de su familia porque ya tenían un hijo en aquel entonces.
Para mejorar sus ganancias trata de mantener sus terrenos limpios de maleza y fertiliza constantemente sus terrenos de cultivo con abono orgánico.Cuando el trabajo es demasiado pesado contrata trabajadores del lugar a quienes paga por adelantado y solo así puede terminar a tiempo las distintas tareas agrícolas.
Vende las cosechas que obtiene a los compradores del su localidad quienes le pagan un precio de acuerdo a la calidad en que se encuentran sus productos y eso le permite recuperar el dinero que invirtió con ganancias adicionales.Este su segundo préstamo con Kiva y se siente agradecido por el apoyo financiero que recibe para continuar con su negocio.En esta oportunidad desea contar con 2,000 nuevos soles para  comprar  abono orgánico y así nutrir a sus sembríos.
texts.en: Apolinaria is 48 years old, married, and lives in an adobe house with her 4 children. Apolinaria and her husband have been farming for 20 years and their work focuses on maintain in good condition cocoa plantations and other plants that they own as these plants are their economic basis. She began with the help of her parents who gave her some farmland to earn money and help with family expenses because she and her husband had a child at that time. In order to improve her earnings she tries to keep her lands clean from pestilence and constantly fertilizes her farmland with organic fertilizer. When the work is very hard she contracts with workers who she pays to complete distinct agricultural tasks. She sells the crops she obtains to buyers in her area who pay an agreed-upon price depending on the quality of her products. This permits her to recoup the money that she invested with her additional earnings. this is her second loan with Kiva and she is grateful for the financial support she receives in order to continue with her business. With this loan she seeks 2000 nuevos soles to buy organic fertilizers and in this way feed her crops.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Aminata

texts.fr:
Madame Aminata, une dame de la quarantaine, s’active dans la vente de poissons frais. Elle a acquis une expérience de plus de 10 ans. Chaque matin, elle démarre sa journée à 9h et fini à 19h du soir. Elle n’a besoin que de 50000F CFA pour acheter une caisse de poissons frais et avoir un fond de roulement.
Aminata est veuve et mère de famille, elle a la charge de ses enfants mais reçois aussi l’appui de ses frères pour mettre ses enfants dans de bonnes conditions.
Avec les bénéfices, elle réussi à épargner régulièrement et à augmenter son fond de roulement pour  hausser son offre.
texts.en:
Aminata is in her forties and she is actively involved in the sale of fresh fish.  She has more than ten years of experience in this field.  She starts work every morning at 9AM and ends at 7PM.  She only needs 50,000 CFA francs to buy one crate of fresh fish and to build some working capital.

Aminata is a widow with a family to raise.  Although she takes care of her children, she also receives some support from her brothers, which allows her to provide good living conditions for her children.

With her profits, she manages to regularly save some money and to increase her working capital and her supply of goods.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish for resale at the local markets.

loans.name: Princess

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Princess. She is married and has two children, aged 8 and 6. In 1998, Princess established her garie, flour and ground nut business. She began her business because she wanted to assist her husband and family. Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are all classes of people. Working seven days a week and 16 hours a day, she earns about Le 400,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Princess requires a loan in order to purchase more garie, flour and ground nut for resale. In the future, Princess plans to build a house and to give her children quality education. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more garie, flour and ground nut for resale.

loans.name: Ramatu

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Ramatu.  She is married, and has two children ages ten and three. 

In 2007, Ramatu established her provision, chicken, sausage and eggs-by-the-carton business. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband and family. Her business is located in  the outskirts, and she has a wide variety of customers. Working 7 days a week and 15 hours a day, she earns about Le380,000 every month from this business. 

Ramatu would like a loan of Le4,000,000. She wants to purchase more milk, chicken, etc. to sell. 

In the future, Ramatu plans to educate her children to the university level and to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more milk, chicken, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Santigie

texts.en:
This is 36-year-old Santigie. He is married, and has one child aged 10 years. In 1988, Santigie established his beans, corn, palm oil, etc., business. He began his business because he was not educated, so he decided to start up a business so that he could help himself. His business is located in the outskirts, and his main customers are women and retailers. Working seven days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about Le 250,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Santigie requires a loan in order to purchase more beans, corn, and palm oil for resale. In the future, Santigie plans to extend his business from a store to a shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy more palm oil, corn and beans for resale.

loans.name: Taslime

texts.en:
This is 40-year-old Teslime. He is married and has one child, aged 15. In 2007, Teslime established his plastic bowls, buckets, cups, etc., business. He began this business because he was not educated, so he wanted to help himself. His business is located in the outskirts, and his main customers are all classes of people. Working seven days a week and 18 hours a day, he earns about Le 400,000 every month from this business. 

He would like a loan in the amount of Le 5,000,000. Teslime requires a loan in order to purchase more plastic bowls, cups, etc. In the future, Teslime plans to construct a bakery as a means of generating more income. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more plastic bowls, cups, etc., for resale.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
This is 30-year-old Mariama. She is married, and has two children aged 10 and 8. In 1992, Mariama established her oil, salt, onion, etc., business. She began this business because she wanted to help her husband and family. Her business is located in the outskirts and her main customers are women, children and men. Working seven days a week and 16 hours a day, she earns about Le 900,000 every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 4,000,000. Mariama requires a loan in order to purchase oil, salt, onion, etc., for resale. In the future, Mariama plans to educate her children up to the university level, and also to build a house. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase oil, salt, onion for resale.

loans.name: Djantoyerela I Group

texts.fr:
Les  10 membres du groupe  DJANTOYERELA I  sont des femmes mariées  ayant une moyenne d’âge de 45 ans, 6 enfants et vivant toutes dans des  familles polygames à BOUGOULA, un des villages de SANANKOROBA, 2ème région administrative du Mali. 
Elles collaborent avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso afin de mener à bien leurs activités agricoles pendant l’hivernage. 
Elles sont à leur deuxieme prêt avec l’institution.
La spéculation cultivée est  le riz  avec  WASA , 2 eme assie de la gauche vers la droite  sur la photo.
Avec son prêt, elle compte acheter des intrants, des semences et payer les frais de labour pour entretenir  0,5 hectare. 
La production est vendue au niveau du village, au marché de SANANKOROBA, après la récolte à une clientèle composée de revendeurs et de consommateurs. 
Elle compte réaliser un bénéfice  de 40.000FCFA par campagne.
Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer son prêt et aussi d’aider son mari dans les dépenses quotidiennes.
texts.en:
The ten members of the DJANTOYERELA I group are married women who, on average, are 45 years old and have six children each. They all live in polygamous families in Bougoula, one of the villages of the Sanankoroba commune (second administrative region of Mali).

They have joined the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso in order to successfully carry out their farming activities during the rainy season. They are on their second loan with the institution. 

The featured borrower, Wasa, grows rice. In the photo, she is in the sitting row, second from the left. She plans to use her loan to buy agricultural inputs and seeds and to pay for the cost of plowing to cultivate 0.5 hectare (1.23 acre) of land.

After the harvest, she sells her crop to both consumers and resellers, in her village and at the Sanankoroba market.

Wasa is expecting to make an average profit of 40,000 CFA francs per season. This profit will allow her to repay her loan and to help her husband cover the daily expenses.

loans.use: to pay for the cost of plowing and to buy seeds and agricultural inputs.

loans.name: Dúo Buena Vista Group

texts.es: La señora Marta Lucrecia, de 42 años de edad y se dedica al bordado de blusas típicas a máquina, y a la elaboración de delantales actual mente Tiene varias blusas que bordar pero el hilo que tiene no le alcanza y necesita comprar más cajas de hilos en varios colores para poder completar el pedido de sus clientes. Por eso ella necesita más capital y así poder seguir trabajando,esta solicitando este credito para la compra de materia prima para la elaboracion en bordados de blusas.
texts.en: Marta Lucrecia, 42 years old, works embroidering traditional blouses by machine and making aprons. Right now she has several blouses to embroider but she does not have enough thread and she needs to buy more boxes of thread in various colors in order to be able to complete her customers' orders. For this reason she needs more resources and so in order to continue working she is seeking this loan in order to buy raw material for the embroidery of blouses.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for the embroidery of blouses
